She rents a space in the market, where she is well-known by many clients who are faithful to her. She purchases clothing for women and children. She currently needs new stock; it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES, to purchase 3 bales of second-hand clothing.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anetou

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Novissi à Lomé ; elle est mariée à un conducteur de taxi et le couple a 02 enfants. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente des fruits saisonniers ; actuellement elle vend des bananes de très bonne qualité qu’apprécient particulièrement ses clients. Elle saisit aussi cette occasion pour produire des jus de citrons, d’ananas et de bananes. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter son aide financière à son mari pour subvenir aux besoins du foyer. Elle vend les matins et les soirs également ; elle vend également en gros à des restaurants et certains bars du quartier ; en ce moment elle a besoin d’acheter 01 panier de citrons, 05 paniers d’ananas et 05 paniers de bananes. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Le prêt servira également à agrandir encore plus son commerce.

loans.use: Achat de fruits

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Agatha J., a 36-year-old widow with three children, buys rice by the bag and sells by the cup to the residents of West Point. Agatha talks to her customers politely and sells her rice in a bigger cup – other vendors sells in a little smaller cup than hers and that’s the secret to her business success. Agatha started her business with a small amount of money given to her by her late husband’s family and this has been the only source of income for her family for more than three years.

Agatha and her children have been struggling with a little help from family and friends. Her children are between 1 and 6 years old, in nursery school through 2nd grade respectively. Agatha did not complete high school because she lacked financial support when she was younger; she had no choice but to drop out of her 9th grade class. She lives and works in West Point, close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia. West Point is a very crowded community where life is very hard. As a result of hardship and poverty, the crime rate is very high; therefore, most people living there wish they could afford to relocate. 

Agatha's business enables her to feed and care for her children. She dreams of giving her children a better education, feeding them on time and giving them good medical attention. She is aiming to establish a big rice store in the future. Agatha needs this loan to be able to purchase rice wholesale so she can serve her customers.

United Women is a group of five borrowers led by Agatha J..

loans.use: To purchase rice wholesale

loans.name: Athou

texts.en: Athou K. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables  and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell.  Athou is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a builder. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for the family BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Latré

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente de bijoux de qualité au marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé ; elle a débuté ce commerce en 2003 et elle maîtrise parfaitement son marché. Cette activité lui permet entre autres de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle se rend le plus souvent au Bénin pour acheter des bijoux de qualité, mais aussi au Ghana ; ensuite elle revend ses achats un peu plus chère, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise d’importants bénéfices. Elle vend des colliers, des bagues, des montres-bracelets en or pour dames. Elle est très connue des femmes bureaucrates. Elle prévoit dans l’avenir ouvrir un nouveau point de vente dans le marché de Nukafu, toujours à Lomé. Pour disposer d’un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour effectuer un tel achat. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This woman specializes in selling high-quality jewelry in the market of Hédzranawoé in Lomé. She started her business in 2003 and has perfectly mastered her business. Amongst other things, this business enables her to This business enables her to pay for her needs. She supplies herself with high-quality jewelry from Benin, but also from Ghana; she re-sells this jewelry at a slightly higher price, which enables her to earn strong profits. She sells necklaces, rings and wrist-watches for women. She is very well-known by female bureaucrats. For the future, she foresees opening a new store in the market of Nukafu, also in Lomé. In order to obtain new stock, she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution group WAGES. She is not married and has not children in her care.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jewelry and necklaces

loans.name: Ekua Janet

texts.en:
Ekua Janet A. sells used clothing at Elmina near the new market. She has received senior high school education. She is married and has four children and her husband is a trader.

Janet Ekua has been selling used clothing since 2001. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and apartment rent. Her loan will be used to buy more used clothing to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Dobi

texts.en:
Dobi C. is currently in the business of selling various items such as: plastic plates, cups etc at her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more items in her shop to sell. Dobi is 40 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more plates to sell in her shop

loans.name: Ayélé Kafui

texts.fr: Cette femme est une revendeuse ambulante de pagnes dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé ; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2005. Elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé ; elle vend à crédit ses pagnes pour ses clientes les plus fidèles ; avec cette stratégie, elle arrive toujours à écouler son stock avant la fin du mois. Actuellement elle veut lancer une nouvelle commande de pagnes de qualité ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 pagnes Wax Hollandais, 25 pagnes Hitarget, 30 pagnes Soso et 15 pagnes Bogolan. Elle est confiante qu’elle honorera ses engagements de remboursement.
texts.en:
This woman is a door-to-door salesperson of "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth) in the neighborhood of Kégué in the city of Lomé. She started this business in 2005. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She supplied herself from the Big Market in Lomé. She sells her "pagnes" for credit to her most faithful clients. With this strategy, she always supplies herself with stock before the end of the month. Currently, she wants to launch herself into a new business of high quality "pagnes"; it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES. She will use this loan to buy 25 Wax Dutch brand "pagnes", 25 Hitarget brand "pagnes", 30 Soso brand "pagnes" and 15 Bogolan brand "pagnes". She is confident that she will honor the loans reimbursement dates.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high-quality "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth)

loans.name: Dado Denise

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé ; elle est très expérimentée dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale, puisque c’est en 1994 qu’elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce. Elle a un sens aigu de la gestion ce qui fait qu’actuellement elle a agrandi sa boutique ; en effet, elle vend en ce moment des produits pharmaceutiques communément appelés « produits génériques » qui lui rapportent bien. Elle compte même dans l’avenir vendre aussi des pagnes ; et ouvrir une autre boutique dans un autre quartier qu’elle choisira. Elle a un besoin pressant de renouveler certains de ses produits manquants ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 cartons de lait Pick, 05 cartons de pâte alimentaire, 03 cartons de tomates, 12 boîtes de paracétamol, des fortifiants et bien d’autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the neighborhood of Attiégou in Lomé. She is very well experienced in the sale of general foodstuffs; she launched this business in 1994. She has a keen sense of management, which mean that she is currently enlarging her shop. In fact, at the moment she is currently selling pharmaceutical products, "generic products" which earn good revenues for her. In the future she intends to also sell "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth) and to open another boutique in a different neighborhood of her choosing. She has an urgent need to renew her stock of certain products - it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES. She will use the loan to purchase 5 cartons of Pick brand milk, 5 cartons of pasta, 3 cartons of tomatoes, 12 boxes of paracetamol and several other products. She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products and generic medicines

loans.name: Kegue

texts.fr:
Cette dame qui tient des citrons dans sa main fait partie d’une A. dénommée « K. KEGUE » ; il s’agit d’un groupe de solidarité constitué de 05 femmes, où les membres du groupe mettent ensemble leurs ressources pour le bien être de tous. La dame qui tient du citron est veuve et assure seule l’éducation de son enfant ; elle vend des citrons depuis 2007.
Deux femmes du groupe vendent du charbon ; l’une d’entre elle est mariée alors que l’autre est veuve ; la première a débuté son commerce depuis 2007 alors que la seconde exerce son activité depuis 2006. 
Une troisième femme vend de l’huile de palme et elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2006.
Enfin la cinquième dame vend de la boisson locale et cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses 04 enfants ; elle autre a débuté son commerce depuis 2004. Tous les membres du groupe « K. kegue » sollicitent un crédit de WAGES pour renforcer leurs activités ; elles n’ont aucune inquiétude pour rembourser ce prêt car elles comptent sur la caution solidaire et l’obligation morale des unes envers les autres.
texts.en:
This woman, who is holding the lemons in her hand, is part of an organization known as "K. KEGUE". This group consists of 5 women and the woman consolidate their resources for the well-being of everyone in the group.

The woman that holds the lemons is widowed and is responsible for the education of her child on her own. She has sold lemons since 2007.

Two women in the group sell charcoal; one of whom is married and the other is widowed. The first started her business in 2007 and the second began her enterprise in 2006.

The third woman sells palm oil and debuted her business in 2006.

Finally, the fifth woman sells local drinks, which enables her to provide for the needs of her 4 children; she started her business in 2004.

All of the women in the group "K. Kegue" are requesting a loan to strengthen their activities. They are not worried about repaying this loan because they count on their solidarity and each woman's moral obligation to one another.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, palm oil, lemons and sacks of corn.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B. sells second hand clothing’s at Elmina near Teremu.  Ama has no educational background.  She is married and has three children. Ama has been selling second hand clothing’s since 2005. She supports the husband in the payment of school fees and payment of apartment. Her loan will be used to buy more bales to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build her own house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more bales of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Cet homme a ouvert un cafétéria non loin du marché de Hedzranawoe à Lomé ; il a débuté cette activité en 2007 et cela lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 02 enfants. Ce cafétéria est très visité par beaucoup de clients visitant le marché mais aussi par des gens du quartier. Il vend aussi des boissons et peut aussi servir des plats entiers. Actuellement vu le nombre élevé de sa clientèle, il compte aménager son mini restaurant pour accueillir plus de monde ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un nouveau congélateur qui peut recevoir plus de boissons ; le reste du prêt servira évidemment aux frais d’aménagement de son cafétéria  et couvrir les imprévus. Il est convaincu que  ce crédit apportera un grand changement dans son commerce.

loans.use: Achat d'un congelateur

loans.name: Bazarsad

texts.en:
Bazarsad is 66 years old and lives with her grandson in the Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. The two of them live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, in the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire of Khar-khorin. Her grandson currently attends the Technology and Science University of Mongolia. 

Bazarsad owns and operates a small store in her town selling a variety of grocery and consumer products. Her grandson helps out at the store by selling ice cream, which is a very popular item during the hot Mongolian summers.
 
Bazarsad started her shop in 2003 after retiring from her career as an obstetrician at the local hospital. With the addition of the ice-cream sales, she has been able to grow her business quickly and has slowly increased the variety of products she sells. She attributes her success to her good personality and customer-service practices that make her business popular in her community. 

For the future, Bazarsad hopes to continue to expand her business. Her wish is that she can continue to support her grandson so that he can graduate and find a decent job. She is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug loan to purchase more groceries and ice cream for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and ice cream for her store

loans.name: Messanvi

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge ; en 2005, il s’est lancé dans la vente de produits congelés et de poissons. Il exerce cette activité dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé. Il revend ses produits congelés et ses poissons aux femmes revendeuses de ces produits dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il vend aussi ses produits à des ménages ; il dispose de bons réfrigérateurs qui conservent bien ses poissons et viandes ; c’est pour cela que sa boutique est très visitée et appréciée de beaucoup de personnes. Actuellement il a besoin de commander des poissons et poulets à conserver. Pour cette raison, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour effectuer ces achats. Il a la certitude qu’il remboursera son crédit à temps.

loans.use: Achat de poissons et de viandes congelées

loans.name: Mamadou Dit Ngouda

texts.fr: Mamadou dit Ngouda M.  est âgé de 31 ans et travaille comme électricien  à l’usine de transformation de produits halieutiques de la ville de Mbour situé à 80 km de la capitale Dakar. Parallèlement à cette activité il gère un véhicule de transport (taxi). Les revenus tirés du transport lui permet d’entretenir sa famille.   Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter un  moteur  pour dépanner sa voiture de transport urbain.

loans.use: achat moteur

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme s’est lancé l’année dernière dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale & divers, en louant une boutique dans le quartier de Novissi à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à ses propres besoins. Il est dynamique et accueille bien ses clients. Il n’est pas encore marié et n’a pas non plus aucun enfant à sa charge. Il a de grandes ambitions pour son commerce ; actuellement il réalise de bonnes affaires, vu le nombre élevé de sa clientèle. Il a besoin en ce moment de renforcer son stock de marchandises ; c’est pour cela qu’il souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 02 cartons de Milo pour le thé, 03 cartons de sucre Saint Louis, 01 carton d’eau de javel, 10 cartons de savons de toilette de différentes marques, des biscuits et divers autres articles.
texts.en:
This young man launched his business selling general food stuffs and various goods last year. He is renting a shop in the neighborhood of Novissi in Lomé. This business enables him to take care of himself and his own needs. He is dynamic and is very welcoming to his customers. He is still unmarried and has no child in his care. He has great ambitions for his business; currently, his business is going well and he has a great deal of clients. He needs to re-stock his merchandise and it is for this reason that he is requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES. He intends to purchase 2 cartons of Milo brand tea, 3 cartons of Saint Louis brand sugar, 1 carton of bleach, 10 cartons of soap of various brands, cookies and a variety of other products.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase more shoes and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en: L. Otgonsuren is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. His family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, in a housing district in the city. His two oldest daughters attend secondary school and his youngest child is in kindergarten. With the help of his wife, Otgonsuren operates a small souvenir and shoe selling business at a stand at the local market in their district  Due to his injured leg, Otgonsuren operates the stall while his wife travels to China to purchase products to sell. After leaving his old job, Otgonsuren started his business in 2007 with the hope of having more work freedom and higher earnings. He has found much success in his new trade. Today, his working capital exceeds 2,500,000 tugrugs (~1750 USD) and his daily revenues average between 100,000 - 150,000 tugrugs (~70-105 USD).  Otgonsuren is a very hardworking and open-minded person. He hopes to continue to grow his business in the future with the dream of one day of building a house for his family. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to purchase more supplies and products for his souvenir and shoe stand.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies and products for his souvenir and shoe stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de poussins

loans.name: Xaveur

texts.en:
Xaveur R. is 53 years old and is married. He has no children but he takes care of four dependents.

Xaveur has 5 years of experience in having a small shop and bar. He employs two people working from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. He is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing more goods and drinks in order to satisfy his clients.

Through accessing this loan, Xaveur hopes to earn enough profit through which he will be able to buy a house and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his shop and bar

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
A. Bashorat is 33 years old. She lives with her spouse, and works every day starting very early in the morning so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 4 children successfully finish school and enter University. Her business is located in the central market of Shahrituz and she sells clothes for teenagers. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort Bashorat was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of $700 USD Bashorat will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for teenagers in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Tsagaandorj

texts.en: A. Tsagaandorj is 44 years old and lives with her four children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends University and her youngest daughter and two sons currently attend a local secondary school. Tsagaandorj operates a grocery retail trading business in her town. She sells a variety of food-stuffs at a stand at the local market. Tsagaandorj started her grocery business in 1998 with 200,000 tugrugs (about $140 USD). She has slowly found success and recently used the profits from her business to remodel her home and build a new garage. Although it was a struggle at times in the beginning, her business has achieved a level of stable operations. For the future, Tsagaandorj hopes to continue to expand her business and save money, as two of her children will start university in the next few years. She says, "I want to be able provide for all of my children's university tuition costs". She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (about $1050 USD) loan to purchase more supplies and food items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies and food items for her store.

loans.name: Mumina

texts.en:
Mumina is married and has three children. She owns a place at the central market in Shahrituz, where she sells various types of clothing. Some of the advantages of her business are variety, consistency, and affordable prices. Mumina has been working in this business for 5 years. She is always seeking to grow and develop her business and improve her entrepreneurial skills. Mumina is requesting a loan of $2000 USD to purchase a wider range of goods. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s financial situation.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase a wider range of goods for her store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 32 years old she is married and has two children. All her children are currently in school. She works very hard to support the husband in taking care of the family.  She is a baker who uses flour for her production for fifteen years now.  She is very popular in her community where she lives and this has enhanced her business growth. In spite of the challenges she faces. She bakes bread and retails them to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers and people also take bulk delivery from her. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests a loan support to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can meet the high demand of her customers. She would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en: Chimgee lives with her parents and son in own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends secondary school and her mother is retired. Chimgee operates and manages a traditional shoe making business with her father. She makes two different types of traditional shoes, one called Buriad and the other is called Mongol. She started her business in 2006 and at that time only produced the Buriad shoes. As she began gaining more experience and customers, she expanded her product line to include the Mongol shoes. Through her hard work, she has been able to buy tools and rent a small work area. One day, she would like to own her own store where she can sell her products, expand her product line and also attract new customers. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more supplies and tools for her shoe making business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies and tools

loans.name: Tuihailiah Group

texts.en: Nessie is a 40 year old Liberian business woman who resides along the Dama Road, Foyah District, Lofa County.  A widow with 5 children and a 12th grade education, she has been selling oil goods for about 3 years now, and faces challenges due to financial shortage and illness. She has been successful, however, in attracting customers through good treatment. Her dream is to build a provision shop which will enable her cater to her children’s education and medical needs.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale oil for resale

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
M. Ergash is 48 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Ergash is a market vendor. He has been selling the fruits for 18 years already. For these years Ergash had acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruits so that to keep their marketable conditions and not to lose the taste and useful properties. He is selling fruits such as: apple, peach, pomegranate in the center local market. In the market he is known among people because of the attractive prices and friendly characteristic feature. All this allows Ergash’s business to generate the stable considerable incomes for his family. Due to the season now Ergash’s selling goods are in high demand. For this reason he is planning to purchase the more fruits for selling. He is requesting for a loan of $1500 USD that will allow him to expand his business. Ergash thanks everyone for supporting him.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a seamstress. Through her hard work and commitment, she has eight apprentices who are learning skills for their future livelihood. Helena has been sewing for 14 years now. She is a specialist in women's clothing. Her skills and designs are first class. She sews styles that give her customers a new look: like kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit (tailored top and long skirt), wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She wants to use this loan to buy more supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

Helena is 31 years old, married and the mother of two children. Her husband works very hard to help her take care of the home. Currently, her kids are in school. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Productive Youth Group

texts.en:
Productive Youth is a group of five borrowers led by Chea T.. Chea is a 22-year-old high school graduate and a single father of a 5-year-old child. His child’s educational level is Kindergarten 2.

Chea lives in the Samuel K. Doe community, which is in the industrial area south of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. This swampy community was established by former president Samuel K. Doe for people who cannot afford buying land of their own. Later, when the civil war came, people did illicit building. Therefore, it is like a refugee camp. 

Chea’s business is footwear. He buys wholesale and sells retail in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He started this business with a small amount and is still doing well. From this business, Chea takes care of himself and his son as well as educating both of them. He takes his business very seriously because he doesn’t have anyone who can take care of his child for him.

Chea has been running this business for more than three years and giving his customers quality products is what brought him this far. Chea's goal is to grow his business and own a big store. He needs this loan in order to purchase footwear wholesale and sell retail to acquire more profit. Chea dreams of changing his life and that of his child and of saving for his family to come.

loans.use: He needs this loan in order to purchase footwear wholesale and sell retail to acquire more profit.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza A. sells dry beans, maize, and groundnut at Elmina near the new market.  Adiza has received junior high school education.  She is married and has one chid. Adiza has been selling dry beans, maize and groundnut since 2006. She supports the husband in the payment of school fees and payment of apartment. Her loan will be used to buy more maize, groundnut and beans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize, groundnut and beans to sell.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
M. Bahodir is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 6 years. He is baking the national bread “lepeshka” at home. He believes that this business is profitable and is not the subject to the seasonality. He is getting up early and baking the lepeshka and bread so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the input materials like the flour, salt, yeast he is purchasing in the local market. Now due to high demands Bahodir wants to increase the number of his breads so that he requests for a loan of $1500 USD. The loan will be spend for purchasing the flour, and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Bahodir deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing the flour as a wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
42-year-old Elizabeth is married with two children, both currently at school. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and works very hard as a mother to support her family.

For five years, Elizabeth has been a local manufacturer of soap. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil to produce her popular soap called 'Azumah Blows'. However, she is unable to produce large quantities due to lack of funds.

Elizabeth would like to take out a loan to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale-up her production. She hopes to increase her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to her children and she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make soap

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
H. Ravshan is 19 years old. He is a young craftsman. He has a small shop for repairing electronic devices like TVs, radios, CD recorders, tape recorders and others. He was taught this technical skill by his father. Being a good repairman, Ravshan is also able to suggest equipment of a better quality and more attractive price to his clients. His business is very stable and brings significant support for his family. Today Ravshan requests 3000 Somoni in order to purchase spare parts and a diagnostic device for repairing electronics. Ravshan thanks all lenders for their support and wants to ensure them that he will repay the loan with accuracy and on time.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts and a diagnostic device for repairing electronics

loans.name: Women' S Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a 26-year-old Liberian businesswoman who lives on Dama Road, Foyah District, in Lofa County. She is married with three children of her own, and one orphan who is in the third grade. Sarah is illiterate. She has been selling dry goods for about five years now, and faces challenges such as financial shortages and illness. She is, however, successful in attracting customers thanks to her good customer care and sales pitch.

Sarah dreams of building a provisions shop which will enable her to fund her children's education and medical care needs.

loans.use: Children's clothes etc. for retail sale

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en: Adriana B. sells smoked fish at Elmina Kumasi.  Adriana has received senior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Adriana has been selling smoked fish since 1999. She helps husband in the paying of utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke by way of processing and sold at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her children to further their education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke by way of processing and sold at the market.

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.en:
Mohiniso is a hard-working entrepreneur from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She is widow and has two children. She runs a business where she sells clothing for teenagers. Mohiniso started her business five years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. Her son helps Mohiniso with her business. It is an important source of income for her family as it is their only source.  Mohiniso has requested a loan of $800 USD so that she can purchase more clothing to sell. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to expand her business further and feed her family.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more clothing for expanding her business.

loans.name: Ashur

texts.en:
Ashur has 9 years of experience in producing vegetables in his community, which has a favorable climate and where the cultivation of these crops is an established tradition. He works the fields with the support of his elder son, who is also dedicated to the production. The maintenance of the land has a high cost, due to the attention that must be given to the plants in each phase of the productive process: manually weeding, using organic fertilizer and natural supplements for the control of diseases. These give better yields to their crops, since they prevent the soil from deteriorating so much, provide better conditions for cultivation at planting time and improve the quality of the crop, increasing its value since organic products currently obtain better prices in the market. Ashur requests a loan for the purchase of supplies for his crop such as: seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. The loan will greatly improve Ashur’s income and his family's living standards.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua started her fish business fifteen years-ago in a community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish and for that reason she is well-liked by many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Akosua is a 50 year-old divorcee and mother of four children, all currently in school. She uses her business proceeds to support her children: buying them food, and paying school and medical bills. She requires a loan to buy more stock of assorted fish, so as to increase sales to support her children's education and grow her business. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a twenty-year-old single man. He has been working as a house painter since 2006, servicing the neighboring areas. Since becoming well-known in his town, Mohamad is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional tools to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools for painting business

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends university while her husband is employed as a carpenter in a flour factory. Oyungerel and her family live together in their own little house. 

Oyungerel owns and operates a clothing business where she makes both European and Mongolian clothing. She started her clothing business in 2007 and, because the clothing has been so popular, has been able to hire two assistants. She would someday like to open her own store for her clothing. Oyungerel is requesting a 3,000,000 Tugrug (~2,100 USD) loan to purchase more fabrics and materials in order to expand her product range and attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials for clothing business

loans.name: God Help Us Group

texts.en: Around the Police Station, Foyah District, Lofa County, Saah lives with 2 children whose ages range from 1 and 3 years; their education level is daycare. He has sold dry goods for about 2 years now and with this activity he caters to his children and supports them in school. His challenge has been the lack of finance over the years, but is successful in attracting his customers by words of encouragement. He dreams of a bigger business to adequately support his children.

loans.use: assorted dry goods (batteries, toothburshes, manpo, etc)

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a 33-year old woman. She is married and the mother of four children. All her children are currently in school in the community where they live. She is a food vendor and sells rice balls with soup. Rice balls are prepared from cooked rice grains and it is taken with hot soap. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to support her business to include the sale of cereals in bags to her customers. She always saves parts of her profit for unforeseen occurrences. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 28-year-old married man and have one baby child. He has owned a maintenance shop since 2006 in his town. Today, Mohamad is applying for a loan of $1,200 in order to renovate his tools instead of the old ones to be updated and satisfy the need of the market.

loans.use: to renovate his tools

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: H. Julienne est née le 25/05/1958 à Adjohoun. Julienne est mariée à DEDEDJI GERMAINE, un tailleur. Ce couple a à sa charge trois enfants qui sont les tiens. La famille réside depuis un an à Avrotrou, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Julienne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Julienne mène comme activité la vente de tissus. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Julienne achète ses tissus et elle les vend de façon ambulante. Julienne a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Julienne demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de tissus.

loans.name: Stand By Me Group

texts.en: Tewah is a 24 year old illiterate Liberian businesswoman, married with 3 children along with 2 orphans whose education is yet to be planned. She has sold oil goods for about 3 years now, and faces challenges with financial shortage and illnesses. She’s however successful in attracting customers by good speech. She dreams of improvement which will enable her to cater to her children's education as well as provide good medical treatment for all of them.

loans.use: Oil by tins, gallons, drums and to be sold at retail

loans.name: Joel Group

texts.en:
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

The leader of this small group with the group name ‘Joel’ is Paul and he is the one sitting in the group photograph. He is currently in the business of grocery products and sells items like cold drinks, evaporated milk, sugar, biscuits etc. and is requesting a loan to buy a stock in bulk. Paul is 43 years old and is married. He has four children, ranging from age 18 to 4, and his children go to school. He takes delivery of stock in Kumasi central market in bulk and retail to his customers in his shop. He requests for the loan to buy increased stock to upgrade his inventory.

loans.use: To buy stock like milk, sugar, biscuits etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is married and has six dependants. She has received schooling through senior high.   Elizabeth sells groceries like Milo milk sugar ECT at Elmina holy wood school, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a fisherman.  Elizabeth uses her income to support the husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Our Want Group

texts.en: Abraham is a 26 year old high school graduate Liberian businessman, married with 2 children whose education level is daycare. He's involved in produce buying (Cocoa, Coffee, etc) for about 3 years now, and faces challenges with financial shortage and illnesses. He’s however successful in attracting his customers by good treatment and speech. He dreams of building a provision shop which will enable him to cater to his children's education as well as provide good medical treatment for all of them.

loans.use: purchasing produces (Cocoa, Coffee, etc)

loans.name: Mano River Union (Mru) Group

texts.en: Around the Sogolo town community, Foyah District, Lofa County, Sarah lives with 2 children whose ages range from 2 and 7 years; their education level is daycare. She has sold dry goods for about 4 years now and from this activity she caters to her children and supports them in school. Her challenge has been the lack of finance, but she is successful in attracting her customers by words of encouragement and offering affordable prices. She dreams of a bigger business to adequately support her kids.

loans.use: additional goods (batteries, salt, sardines, etc)

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
Johnson is 35 years old he is married and has four children. Three of his children are in school. He is very hardworking and supportive to the wife in providing food and shelter for his household. He owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. He also sells goat meat in the market. With the loan, he wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil and boxes of biscuits etc. to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve his savings to support his wife in taking care of the children educational needs. He is been in this business for three years now and takes stock of goods from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ruth’. He is the one sitting in the group photograph. Members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this small group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Pastor 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Evelin O. (third from left in the photo) is a young entrepreneur who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for a borrowing group called El Señor es mi Pastor (The Lord is my Shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Evelin lives in Boca Chica, a small coastal town about 30 minutes west of San Pedro de Macorís. She is 22 years old, and this is her very first loan with Esperanza. Evelin lives with her mother and father, two siblings, and her two children. With her loan, Evelin hopes to expand her business as a shoe saleswoman. Typically, customers will order a certain style or color of shoes, and Evelin will buy them and bring them to the customer’s home. This business plan helps differentiate her from shoe salespeople who only sell on the street or in shops. Evelin is taking out this loan to help her diversify the selection of shoes available to her customers.

Evelin hopes that she can continue to receive loans after her first loan is repaid. Eventually, she would like to have her own store and greatly expand her line of offered products. Her children are very young, and Evelin hopes to send them to the best schools possible so they can have businesses of their own when they grow up. Thank you for lending to Evelin and to El Señor es mi Pastor group!

loans.use: Purchasing new styles of sandals and shoes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice T. sells fresh fish. She goes to the seashore to buy fish to sell at Elmina.  Beatrice has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. Beatrice has been selling fish since 2005. Her income helps pay her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business so she can continue her building.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Business Future Group

texts.en:
Christine, the leader of this group, lives in the T. Taylor community in the Foyah district of Lofa County. She has a three-year-old child who attends daycare. For about three years, Christine has sold dry goods, and this is how she supports her son and pays for his school fees. She sells items such as salt, onions, cubes, and seasonings.

Her challenge has been lack of finances, but she is successful in attracting her customers through word of mouth and by offering affordable prices.

She dreams of a bigger business someday to adequately support her son.

loans.use: To improve her dry-goods sales business

loans.name: Ambica

texts.en:
Ambica P. lives in Koteshwor, Nepal. Koteshwor is located in the Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in their own businesses. Ambica P. has four members including herself in her family. Her husband's name is Bhishma Raj P.. He works in a private office. They have two children. Her older son is studying in grade 11 and the younger son is studying in grade 10.
Four years ago Ambica opened her ready made clothes shop to uplift the living standard of her family. She sells different types of clothes in her shop. She specializes in children clothes. 
Now Ambica is requesting Rs25000.00 loan to buy new design clothes for her shop.

loans.use: to buys readymade clothes for her shop

loans.name: Ezekiel Group

texts.en:
Kofi is 40years old he is married and father of five children. All his children are in school in the community where they live. He is a steel binder and iron rods seller. He takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He binds the steel and sells to contractors as a building material. He complains that the cost of the iron rods is on the higher side and demand for a loan assistance to enable him purchased them in bulk.

He is the leader of a small trust bank group called ‘Ezekiel’. He is the one sitting in the group photograph. Members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and metal worker etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy iron rods in bulk.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita B. is the tailor in the village of Bhakepati. She opened her tailoring shop six years ago. Before starting her own business, she did six months of tailoring for a tailoring business. She makes school uniforms for boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta salwar, blouses, ladies’ long dresses, makshi, and other such clothes. Now Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of 25,000 rupees to buy materials like cotton cloth for her tailoring work.

Mrs. B. lives with her husband, two daughters and two sons. Her sons are studying in grades 5 and 9 and her daughters are studying in grades 2 and 7.

loans.use: To buy materials like cotton cloth

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells tiger nut pudding; she buys tiger nuts and process it to get her pudding at Elmina.  Elizabeth has received junior high school education.  She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a fisherman. Elizabeth has been selling tiger nut pudding since 1997. She supports the husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more tiger nuts to prepare her pudding for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more tiger nuts to prepare her pudding for sale.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua hawks fresh apples in the community where she lives. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi and sells in the commercial vehicle station. She is 28 years old, divorced and the mother of two children. Currently her children are living with her divorced husband’s mother in the eastern region of Ghana. This has reduced the burden on her shoulders, but she works hard to send the grandmother money for the children's upkeep.

Akua is requesting a loan to buy a bulk supply of apples to meet the daily demand of her customers. She deems it an opportunity to increase her savings so that she can always have money to supplement her business and support her children.

loans.use: To increase stock of fresh apples

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia D. is currently in the business of selling bread and pastries and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Cecilia is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sangita T. is the resident of Bhakepati. Bhakepati is located in Kathmandu district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. Sangita T. lives in a single family with her husband one son. Her husband is a farmer and sells the vegetables in the local market. Her son is studying in pre-primary school. 

The income from her husband is not enough to run her family smoothly. So Mrs. Sangita T. decided to open her own grocery store. She opens her grocery store two years ago in Bhakepati. She sells different types of grocery foods in her shop such as rice, maizes, various snacks etc. She uses her income in household expenses.

Sangita is applying for a loan of 10, 000 Nepalese Rupees to purchase additional grocery stock for her shop

loans.use: To buys gorcery goods for her shop

loans.name: Belonbaboa Group

texts.en:
Allen is a 48-year-old Liberian businessman. He is married with three children. As he himself is illiterate, it is very important to him that his children attend school. He has sold mixed goods such as lox, salt, oil, pepper, and sardines at market for about five years.

Allen faces challenges with financial shortage and illnesses. However, he is successful in attracting his customers by his excellent customer service and market skills.

He dreams of building a provision shop, which will enable him cater to his children's education as well as to ensure good medical treatment for the family.

loans.use: To buy additional mixed goods to sell at market

loans.name: Labor For Profit Group

texts.en:
James F. is a Liberian businessman living in Foyah Town in Lofa County. He is married and has two children in elementary school. As he is illiterate himself, his children's education is very important to him.

James has been selling dry goods (particularly housewares) for about two years now. He faces challenges with financial shortages, but he is successful in attracting his customers through good treatment and speech.

He dreams of building a provision shop which will enable him to cater to his children's education as well as to ensure good medical treatment for all of them.

loans.use: To buy additional housewares for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 41 years old she is divorced and mother of two children. Currently they are all in school. She sells porridge at her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. Her porridge is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taking with what we called Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise good income to support her kids in school and make business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Bakita

texts.en: Bakita J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Bakita is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build charcoal store BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nanichori

texts.en:
Mrs. Nanichori B. is a tailor in the town of  Bhakepati.  She opened her tailoring shop few years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar which are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs B. took a 6 month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.
She is requesting for Rs 30000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education. 
She has one son and one daughter. Both of her children are now studying in higher level.

loans.use: To buys raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Mary B. lives in the Foyah Market Community. She is widowed and has five children. For about six years, Mary has been engaged in the sale of fish and rice at retail prices. Financial problems and illiteracy have been her biggest challenges, and but she is successful in attracting consumers to her business by using effective sales methods.

She dreams of someday owning a storage center which will help her more successfully to support all of her children.

loans.use: To buy fish and rice for market sale

loans.name: Kae Yesu Group

texts.en:
Felicia is 32 years old and married. She is the mother of two children, both currently in school. She operates a drinking spot where she sells beverages such as canned and bottled soft drinks. She has built a wooden kiosk from which she sells her drinks. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to help her business expand and to provide her children with quality education. However, she worries that she will not have adequate funds to realize that dream.

She is been running her establishment for three years now. She is humbly requesting your help in the form of a loan that she will use to make her dream come true. With the loan, she wants to purchase an increased stock of assorted drinks from the wholesalers to restock her shop. Her goal is to gain more resources with which to take care of the family.

Felicia is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Kae Yesu,’ which means 'Remember Jesus.' She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi, and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Malah Kissia Group

texts.en: Siah is illiterate and has three children. She is a widow engaged in the sale of dry goods (plastic dishes) at retail prices, a business which she has been in for almost two years. Financial problem have been her biggest challenge but she has been successful in her business by using good methods applied to the sale of her goods and to her customers. She dreams of owning a provision shop which will help her supply the needs of all of her children.

loans.use: To buy additional plastic dishes, tubs, etc.

loans.name: Binita

texts.en:
Mrs. Binita S. is a resident of Chetrapati, which is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small business.

Mrs. S. lives with her husband and three children: one son and two daughters. Both of her daughters are studying in grade 5 and her son studies in grade 2.

Mrs. S. opened her cosmetics shop a few years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. In her shop she sells different types of cosmetics such as make-up tools, lipsticks, glass bangles, etc. She uses her earnings to pay household expenses.

Now, Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10,000 to invest in her cosmetics shop.

loans.use: To buy make-up tools for her shop

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La Sra. Herminia D. de 35 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Alejandro Ferreira de 42 años de edad, ellos tienen la dicha de tener  3 hijos todos en edad escolar.
   Doña Herminia es comerciante y docente, ella empezó a realizar esta actividad aproximadamente en el año 2.002; con el capital que llegaron ahorrar del sueldo que tiene como docente, desde ese tiempo invirtieron en cabinas telefónicas para generar  un ingreso aparte de su salario, en la actualidad vende  también golosinas y accesorios para incrementar sus ingresos.
   Ella invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías, con lo cual lograría tener un más stock de productos en ofertas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia D. is 35 years old and is married to Mr. Alejandro Ferreira, who is 42 years old. They have the joy of having 3 children, all of whom are in school. Mrs. Herminia is a merchant and teacher. She started pursuing this activity around 2002, with the capital that she has saved from her salary as a teacher. Since this time, she invested in phone booths to earn an income apart from her salary. At present, she also sells sweets and accessories to increase her earnings. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise, so that she can offer a larger stock of products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, sodas, juices, dairy products, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Faith Group is a group of five borrowers led by 29-year-old David S., a single father with a two-year-old child. David left school in the tenth grade because his parents were unable to offer enough financial support for his education. He lives in West Point, a very crowded and poor community with a high crime rate. West Point is primarily a fishermen's community near Monrovia in Liberia.

David’s business is dry goods, such as sugar, beans, salt, milk, and soap. He also sells t-shirts. He buys these items in wholesale and sells in retail to the residents of downtown Monrovia.
 
David started his business with LD $1,000.00 and has built it up to LD $6,000.00. He is grateful for the success of his business because it has been supporting him and his child.

David has been engaged in this work for five years and hopes to bring it to a higher level in business. He fosters good relationships with his customers, and they have repaid him with their loyal and ongoing business.

He needs this loan to purchase more dry goods and t-shirts wholesale to sell in retail. He means to use his profits to improve his bbusiness. David dreams of building a better for himself and his son and to plan for a secure future.

loans.use: To purchase dry goods and t-shirts for retail sale

loans.name: Santos Marta

texts.es: Santos Marta D. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Vive con su hija Yamileth de 12 años de edad estudiante y su esposo Don Jose que trabaja como albañil donde sus ingresos no son muy estables, ya que no siempre hay trabajo para él. Santos se dedica a la elaboración de tamales para luego venderlos con sus vecinos , el crédito que solicita Santos es para compra de insumos que le permitan aumentar la producción de tamales para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para elaborar tamales

loans.name: Karen Liseth

texts.es: Karen Liseth T. de 29 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado municipio del departamento de San Salvador, vive con sus tres hijos todos menores de edad y su  esposo quien se dedica a trabajar como mecánico. Karen posee su propio negocio ubicado en el centro de Ciudad Delgado, donde vende variedad de verduras, el crédito que solicita Karen es para surtir su puesto con más variedad de productos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Karen Liseth T. is 29 years old and lives in Ciudad Delgado, a municipality in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her three children, all of whom are young, and her husband, who works as a mechanic. Karen has her own business located in the center of Ciudad Delgado, where she sells a variety of vegetables. The loan that she is requesting will be used to supply her stand with a larger variety of products to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business with vegetables

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El Señor Jaime  de 24  años de edad, vive en pareja hace 2 años con la Sra. Maria Morinigo de 23 años de edad.
  Jaime, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropas. En el 2007,  fue cuando  decidió abrir para su despensa un pequeño ahorro que contaba del trabajo anterior que realizaba.  Actualmente, además de su despensa, también vende repuestos para motos, con un hermano. 
 Como sueño personal desea  ampliar más su negocio, así poder tener un mejor ingreso. 
  El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para motocicletas.

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos para motos.

loans.name: Decadas Group

texts.en:
Milagros P. will be using her loan to purchase charcoal, which she will then sell to her community. Milagros is 56 years old and lives with her husband, one of her four children, and her granddaughter in Punta Pescadora (Fisherman’s Point), a neighborhood on the outskirts of San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. Life in the poorer neighborhoods of San Pedro D. Macorís can be very basic: charcoal for heat and cooking, no potable water and unpleasant housing conditions. Charcoal is a valued commodity here and Milagros has had great success as a saleswoman in her community.

Milagros is one of the coordinators for the group "Decadas" and her story is representative of those in her group. She is very thankful for this loan and hopes that with it her business will be successful and grow. Since her granddaughter is still very young, Milagros hopes that she can use her profits to send the child to good schools and give her a step up in society. This is Milagros’s fourth loan with Esperanza and she has a perfect repayment record! Thank you for lending to Milagros and the Decadas group!

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell to her neighbors

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción M. D. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. María es madre soltera al igual que su hija quien vive con ella y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad. María tiene una tienda ubicada en su domicilio por la cual ahora solita este crédito para utilizar ese dinero en surtir su negocio que carece de muchos productos, María ya ha majeado otros créditos, los cuales tienen y cancelados, y se refleja como una cliente responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
María Concepción M. D. live in the Ilopango municipality in the San Salvador department. María is a single mother like her daughter. Her daughter and one year old grandchild live with her. María has a store located in her house. She is asking for a loan to stock her store because she lacks a lot of products. María has managed other loans and paid them back. She is considered to be a responsible client who is punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Yamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Yamuna S. operates her own bag shop. She sells ladies bags and school bags at her shop. She opened her bag shop two years ago to improve the living standards of her family. These days, she is facing heavy competition in her business. So, to stay competitive, she must be able to provide the latest fashion bags. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 rupees to buy a variety of new fashionable bags to meet her competition.

Mrs. Yamuna S. lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu, with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Dipak lal S., works in a government office. She has two sons and one daughter. All her children are now in school.

loans.use: To buy the latest fashion bags

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel K. is 19 years old, single and he has a small shop selling various goods.He starts his business evey day from 6h00 AM to 7h00PM with experience of one year in this business. Emmanuel is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a for expanding his shop through purchasing many products such as salt, rice sugar etc.
By receiving and using this new loan, Emmanuel with the profits he will get, he has a hope for his future through savings and buying a business house.

loans.use: purchasing more merchandises

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario C. de 32 años de edad es soltero.
   Don Mario posee una carpintería. Empezó con este negocio aproximadamente en el año 1.997 ya que lo heredo de su padre. En la actualidad ya tiene años de experiencia en esta profesión. 
El trabaja exclusivamente con una  empresa quien le hace pedidos de cortes de pisos, y la entrega lo realiza cada quince días o cada mes. 
   El invertiría este crédito en comprar más maderas, para satisfacer la demanda de pedidos de cortes de pisos que tiene. 
Sueña con un país con más fuentes de trabajo y más seguridad.

loans.use: comrpa de madera

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda M. reside en el departamento de Sonsonate. Erlinda es madre soltera ha sacado a su  hija Sandra  adelante atreves de su  negocio, el cual ha  tenido a flote  con veinticinco años de experiencia los que le han permitido ganar de la buena y gran clientela que goza el negocio de frutas y verduras de Erlinda, el crédito que solicita es para surtir su negocio, para  poder seguir expandiendo sus ventas y la gran de manda se sus productos.
texts.en:
Erlinda M. lives in the Sonsonete department. Erlinda is a single mother, and through her business she has helped her daughter advance. She has kept the business afloat. With 25 years of experience, she has gained a lot of good customers who enjoy Erlinda’s fruit and vegetable business. The loan that she is asking for is to stock her business. She will then be able to keep increasing her sales and meet the great demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El Sr. Vicente B. de 56 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Victorina Reyes de 58 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos ya viven en forma independiente, todos ya terminaron su carrera universitaria y cada uno se maneja por cuenta propia, actualmente esta pareja tiene un nieto que vive con ellos y le sirve de compañía.
	En el año 2.003, Don Vicente emprendió su propia microempresa con los ahorros que contaba y abrió una despensa con el fin de generar más ingresos económicos a la familia y poder seguir costeando los gastos del hogar. Sin duda alguna, Don Vicente es un hombre emprendedor  ya que en época de zafra de algodón se dedica al acopio de dicho producto. 
	Se solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías: Arroz, enlatados, harinas, carnes y bebidas en general.

loans.use: Para la compra de carne, compra de gaseosas, compra de galleta, compra de azucar, compra de harina, compra de arroz, compra de yerba, compra de picadillo, compra de jarra plasticas.-

loans.name: Dina Elizabeth

texts.es: Dina Elizabeth R. P. reside en Jayaque en el departamento de La Libertad. Dina de 30 años de edad se encuentra casada con Rafael quien trabaja como albañil, Dina posee una tienda ubicada donde vende productos de consumo, pero ahora Dina solicita de este crédito por que desea surtir su negocio al cual le hacen falta gran variedad de productos que los clientes de Dina solicitan, con este crédito Dina incrementara sus ventas mejorando sus ingresos económicos también.

loans.use: Sutir su negocio

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina T. is the resident of Chetrapati. Chetrapati is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small business. She has four members including herself in her family. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 11 and daughter isin grade 5.
Both Mrs. T. and her husband Mr. Sushil T. open their grocery shop nine years ago in their own house. They sell different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on.  Now Mrs. T. is requesting for Rs. 15000.00 loan to buy different types of grocery items for her business.
She likes to use her increase income to provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra Lizeth M. D. G. resiD. en Colon municipio del departamento D. La Libertad. Sandra tiene 31 años D. edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 6 y 9 años D. edad. Sandra ha montado su negocio desD. su casa el cual le permite estar pendiente D. sus hijos y a su vez atender trabajar, Sandra elabora variedad D. antojitos típicos por las tardes para después ser comercializados por los vecinos que son fieles a sus platillos, el crédito que solicita Sandra, es para comprar mayor cantidad D. insumos que le permitan aumentar la producción D. sus antojitos para generar mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para aumetar la producción de sus antojitos

loans.name: Ena Marisol

texts.es: Ena Marisol H. D. H. D. 31 años D. edad, resiD. en Colon en el departamento D. La Libertad., vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos aun menores D. edad y estudiantes. Ena  ha fabricado su propio horno a base D. ladrillos y cementos, el cual hoy le permite manejar su propia negocio una panadería  donD. se elaboran variedades D. pan, el crédito que solita Ena es para compra D. insumos que le permitan seguir solidificando su negocio .
texts.en:
Ena Marisol H. D. H., 31, lives in Colon in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and their two children. The children are minors who go to school. Ena has maD. her own oven from bricks and cement. The oven allows her to manage her own business, a bakery. She makes a variety of breads. The loan that Ena is asking for is to buy supplies that will allow her to keep solidifying her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make bread

loans.name: Badia

texts.en:
Badia R. is currently in the business of selling beads in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more beads to sell. Badia is 25 years old and is widowed. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beads to sell

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: Jose Ricardo H. C. reside en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Jose tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposa. Por su falta de preparación académica para Jose ha sido difícil encontrar un trabajo, el solo ha cursado hasta el nivel básico lo que acorta sus posibilidades de un empleo con buenas remuneraciones, es por ello que él decidió montar su propio negocio y es así como lleva su capacidad de ventas y su deseo de darle todo a su familia, hoy Jose posee un inventario de camisas y gorras las cuales comercializa de manara ambulante todos los días, trazando semanalmente rutas que abarquen diferentes lugares de todo El Salvador, el crédito que solicita Jose es para surtir su inventario para poder  ofrecer a  sus clientes ventas por mayoreo, donde obtendrá mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Surtir su inventario

loans.name: Vivine

texts.en:
Vivine N. is 42 years old, married with 8 children aged between 15 and 4.

Vivine has an experience of 3 years in having a shop in which she sells various products. She starts shopping from 8h00 A.M to 8h00 P.M. Vivine is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a   for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more foodstuff.

By requesting and using this loan, Vivine plans to help her husband through the profit to buy a house and get more food for her family.

loans.use: purchasing more foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Chasenei Small Marketing Group

texts.en:
In the Chasenei Town Community, Foyah District, Lofa County, Esther lives with her two children, aged 3 and 5 years, both of whom attend daycare.
