She is very well known for the quality of her products and her dependability in their production

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a chain-stitch industrial sewing machine and the material to sew christmas dolls.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is divorced and is the mother of three children who are currently working. She is 38 years old and trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials.

Victoria buys her stock of goods from importers in Kumasi central market. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She also sells smoked and dried fish through hawking (going door-to-door), likewise the clothing materials. She sells her goods in season: when there is demand for one of them then she switches over to that one. She says this strategy has been very helpful to her in taking care of her family as a single parent.

For lack of adequate working capital, Victoria buys small stocks of lace materials and smoked fish. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and smoked fish in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profits to rent a store to trade in and to continue to sponsor her children in school. She would be pleased with your assistance.

loans.use: To buy lace materials and smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Comité De Mujeres Activas De Candía Loma Group

texts.es:
El comité está integrado por 19 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Candia Loma de la ciudad de Atyra, que en su mayoría son comerciantes trabajadoras, actualmente el grupo está en su 6to ciclo del programa de comités de mujeres emprendedoras.
Todas son vecinas del barrio, pequeñas comerciantes de la zona y una de las virtudes de ellas es que son muy unidas, cada fin de semana realizan actividades con la finalidad de generar fondos para la caja de ahorro que posee dentro del comité, y las actividades que desarrollan son ferias de comidas, torneos de volleybal, futbol, y los resultados son muy positivos debido a que la comunidad siempre está expectante de las actividades que realizan las señoras del comité. 
Todas las integrantes reciben un promedio de gs. 700.000 y los préstamos que recibieron de la Fundación Paraguaya lo  invierten en la compra de los siguientes productos : carne, leche, azúcar, almidón, queso, galleta, aceite, bebidas, fideos, arroz, ropas para caballeros y damas, telas, hilos etc .
Las representantes del comité, agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva por el apoyo en otorgarle un préstamo para su capital de trabajo y por las capacitaciones.

loans.use: Para la compra de leche, azúcar, almidón, queso, galleta, aceite, bebidas, fideos, arroz, ropas para caballero y damas, shampoo, tinte, telas, hilos etc.)

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is twenty – nine years old. She is married and has give birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Akosua is a trader. She trades in dried fish. She sells at the local market and supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Akosua buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Teoipsta

texts.en: Teopista is a 59 year married with five children aged between 8 and 25 years. Three of her children go to school. Teopista resides and owns a four roomed house where she staying with eight people. There is electricity and piped water at home.  Teopista takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 20 customers a day. Teopista sells charcoal.  She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping..  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, thieves, feeding the family and increasing prices of clothes. Besides this charcoal business she also sells bananas. Teopista has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for six years servicing her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this twelfth  loan She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal Teopista is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permant business structure.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Hamidou T. a 34 ans, marié et sans enfant, il réside avec son épouse au quartier Dioulasso de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  T.  fait la commercialisation de  maïs  (graines) il y a environ sept  ans. En plus il gère : une pharmacie vétérinaire, une discothèque et une unité de pondeuses. 
Son magasin  d’achat et de vente de céréales se trouve au marché de la ville de Kadiolo. 
Il sollicite un quatrième prêt individuel  auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, les trois premiers s’étant bien déroulés, pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt,  trois tonnes de maïs  à Kadiolo ville les jours de foire et souvent dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs. Ils sont vendues dans la ville de Kadiolo en gros au comptant les jours de foire à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains ( venant de Sikasso et d’autres grandes villes). 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 55.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, payer les intérêts de son prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou T. is 34 years old, he lives with his spouse in the neighborhood of Dioulasso in the city of Kadiolo (in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

Mr. T. has done business selling corn (seeds) for about 7 years. Additionally, he manages a veterinary pharamacy, a disco and a hen-laying business. His store is located in the market of the city of Kadiolo.

He is requesting a fourth individual loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy his growing clientele; the first three were fully repaid.

He will use this loan to purchase three tons of corn from Kadiolo on the days of the fair and from the surrounding villages with corn farmers. He sells mostly in the city of Kadiolo for wholesale in cash during the days of the fairs, to a clientele composed largely of fair-goers, coming from Sikasso and other large cities.

He envisions that this loan will enable him to earn a monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA, which he will use mostly to increase the his business' funds, pay the interest on his loan and contribute to his family's expenses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw is thirty years old. He is married and has give birth to two children, both in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Yaw is a trader. He trades in electrical goods. He sells in a store by the street in his community. He buys his goods from nearby towns. Yaw has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of electrical goods – adaptors, extension boards, wires, etc. to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda C. is from the village of Danao. She is 25 years old. Lyda is engaged and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Lyda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lyda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lyda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Lyda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lyda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is 42 years old and married with eight children aged between 15 and 25 years. Four of her children go to school. Aisha resides in and owns a four-room house where she staying with ten people. There is no electricity and piped water at home.  Aisha takes care of additional family members.  The family gets one meal a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 30 customers a day. Aisha sells cold drinks.  She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly rent, medication, thieves, feeding the family and increasing prices of clothes. Aisha has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her fifteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more drinks. Aisha hope to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business structure.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda

loans.name: Doria

texts.es:
Doria es una madre de familia de 32 años que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 3 y 7 años de edad en casa de su padre ubicada en el pueblo joven Túpac Amaru, en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella alquila algunos cuartos de la casa de su padre, quien vive en Jaén, desde hace 15 años, ofrece habitaciones a estudiantes y trabajadores que vienen de ciudades aledañas. La idea del negocio nació de su padre, que les dejó la casa para que salieran adelante apoyando a las personas que, como ellos, vienen a la ciudad a buscar un mejor porvenir.

Con las ganancias de su negocio Doria ha empezado a hacer algunas refacciones en las habitaciones que aún no estaban completamente construidas, pero todavía le falta terminar de refaccionar la última habitación, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el tendido del piso de de dicha habitación.

Su deseo es brindarle a sus clientes una mejor calidad de vida, por eso trata de refaccionar sus habitaciones. Su mayor anhelo es poner una bodega para generarse ingresos propios y asegurarle una educación de calidad a sus pequeños hijos.

Doria es una persona muy querida y estimada por sus clientes, los que siempre acuden a ella ante cualquier problema.
texts.en:
Doria is a 32-year-old mother who lives with her husband and their two children, aged 3 and 7. They live in her father’s house in the town of Túpac Amaru, in the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 15 years, Doria has rented out rooms in the house to students and workers who come from neighboring cities. The business was the idea of her father, who now lives in Jaén. He left the house to them with the idea that they could succeed by supporting others who, like them, come to the city seeking a better life.

With the earnings from the business, Doria has begun making some renovations to the rooms, one of which is still not completely finished. This loan of 500 soles, her first with Edpyme Alternativa, will go to finish the floor of this room.

Doria’s desire is to offer her clients a better quality of life and this is why she wishes to improve the rooms. Her greatest dream is to also add a small store which would generate its own income and assure that Doria could provide a quality education for her children.

Doria is much loved and respected by her clients, who always turn to her with any problem that may arise.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a floor in rental room.

loans.name: Jiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Jiguissèmè sont exclusivement  des femmes  mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 2 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma 1 un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt  solidaire, tous les prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles font  de la vente d’habits, de tasses,  des fruits, des articles de boutique et des prestations de services telle la couture..
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 douzaines de tasses, 5 paniers d’oranges, 2 régimes de bananes, 3 sacs d’ananas,  3 cartons de pommes, 2 sacs de sucre,  2 bidons d’huile de 20 litres,  3 paquets d’articles divers,  une dizaine de fils à coudre et 3 pièces de tissus. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante et font leurs prestations de service très souvent à domicile. Elles vendent au comptant, quelques fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager  un point pour leurs  prestations.
texts.en:
The four members of this Jiguissèmè group are all married women with an average age of 38 and on average, 2 children, and live in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 4th solidarity loan. The 3 preceding loans were all correctly reimbursed. They sell clothing, basins, fruit, and dry goods, and they provide services such as sewing.

With their new loan they intend to buy 5 dozen basins, 5 baskets of oranges, 2 stalks of bananas, 3 sacks of pineapple, 14 cases of apples, 2 sacks of sugar, two jerrycans of 20 liters of oil, 3 packets of various items, a dozen spools of sewing thread, and 3 lengths of cloth. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Sikasso town in the various markets and in the neighborhoods on foot, and provide their services out of their homes. They sell for cash and occasionally for credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 32,500 F CFA of which part will be put into savings and used for family needs, the rest being invested back into their businesses. They count on having more working capital so as to better satisfy their clientele and to be able to set up a venue for their service-oriented businesses.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Los Tres Amigos Group

texts.es:
el grupo Los Tres Amigos son personas muy simpaticas y amables, tienen varios años de conocerse y son muy unidos, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
el sr. SANTOS GABRIEL I. tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de carnes de res y pollo, tambien vende verduras, actividad la cual realiza de manera ambulante.-  actualmente tambien se esta dedicando a vender, ropa americana ya que los dias de mayor venta para las carnes son los dias sabados y domingos,  en el transcurso de la semana se dedica a vender ropa.
El Sr. I. es casado y de principios cristianos, con su esposa solo han tenido una hija y depende a un 100% de ellos, su esposa se dedica a vender tortillas de maíz.
la sra. MARIA VICENTA I. se dedica al comercio, vende helados, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 1/2 años, ella vende los helados por caja y tambien al detalle, es casada y su esposo es el que le ayuda a vender el Ice Cream en conos, del matrimonio solo depende un hijo, mismo que le ayuda a conducir en el vehiculo cuando salen a vender ropa a diferentes comunidades y cacerios circunvecinas a quebrada Larga.
el sr. JUAN MANUEL NUÑEZ el se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, hace mas de un año que lucha con su propio negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien,  actividad que realiza de manera ambulante, en la aldea que reside y en comunidades circunvecinas a la misma.
don juan es soltero y no depende nadie de él, con los ingresos que recibe desde que se dedica al negocio él ha podido construir su casa de habitación.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus familias y sus negocios.

loans.use: compra de ropa americana, fardos de peluches, platanos, yuca, cajas de ice creams, cajas de conos para ice creams

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 40 year married with five children aged between 7 and 23 years. All her children go to school. Catherine resides and rents s a two roomed house where she is staying with eight people. There is electricity and no piped water at home.  Catherine takes care of additional family members  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 20 customers a day. Catherine sells charcoal.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping..  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, thieves, feeding the family and increasing prices of food. Besides this charcoal business she also sells bananas. Catherine has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for six years servicing her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this twelfth loan She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas Catherine is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and buches of bananas

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita P. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 46 years old. Pacita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a business cultivating decorative trees for sale. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Pacita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 40 year married with 4 children aged between 3 and 14 years.All her children go to school. Betty resides and owns a three roomed house where she staying with six people. There is electricity and no piped water at home. Betty doesn’t take care of any additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 20 customers a day. Betty owns a stall of yellow bananas and sells to all categories of people.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, feeding the family and increasing food prices. Betty has been in this business for 8 years and with MCDT for eight years servicing her sixteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of yellow bananas. Betty is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure and also build a house from the available profits

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Soro Yiriwaso Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  membres du groupe Soro Yiriwaso,  7 femmes  mariées  et de 2 veuves avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma 1  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali.  
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt de groupe, tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font de la vente de beurre de karité, d’articles de boutique, de la friperie,  de l’encens,  du lait,  du sucre, du bois de chauffe, des igname, des oranges etc. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 200 kg de beurre de karité, 2 sacs de sucre, 1 bidon d’huile de 20 litres,  3 paquets d’articles divers, 3 balles de friperie, 2 sacs de lait en poudre,  1 sac de sucre, 15kg de graine (magnon + geunin), 7 bouteilles de parfums différents, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 5 paniers d’orange et 10 sacs d’ignames. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les différents  marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant, en détail et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager leur point de vente et ou en avoir.
texts.en:
The nine members of this Soro Yiriwaso group are 7 married women and two widows, with an average age of 34 and on average, 4 children, and live mostly in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 4th solidarity loan. The preceding 3 loans were all correctly reimbursed. They sell shea butter, dry goods, used clothing, incense, milk, sugar, firewood, yams, oranges, etc.

With their new loan they intend to buy 200 kg of shea butter, 2 sacks of sugar, one jerrycan of 20 liters of oil, 3 packets of various items, 3 bales of used clothing, 2 sacks of powdered milk, 1 sack of sugar, 15 kg of seeds (magnon and guenin) 7 bottles of various perfumes, 1 wagonload of firewood, 5 baskets of oranges, and 10 sacks of yams. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Sikasso town in the various markets and in the neighborhoods on foot, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 30,500 F CFA of which part will be put into savings or used for family needs, the rest being invested back into their businesses. They count on having more working capital so as to better satisfy their clientele and to be able to set up a venue for their sales.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité en achetant des tissus pour la fête de korité

loans.name: Emerson Esael

texts.es:
el sr. EMERSON ESAEL S. R. tiene 13 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo; su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Boulevard la Democracia frente al super mercado ALRACHID de esta ciudad.
Don Emerson, se dedico desde la edad de 12 años al comercio ya que sus padres de igual manera son comerciantes, a él le gusto mas el comercio que los estudios, y solo curso hasta el 2º de secundaría y dejo los estudios.
don emerson cuenta con muy buena experiencia en el comercio ya que la mitad de su vida se ha dedicado al mismo,. Esta casado y nos comento que dentro de un par de meses espara ser padre de su 1º hijo(a)
Ahora el piensa en hacer crecer mas su negocio y tener muchas ganancias ya que se le viene la responsabilidad de mantener a su primer hijo.

loans.use: compra de camisetas deportivas, camisas de vestir, blusas, zandalias, tenis, gorras, trajes, camisas de la seccion de futbol de Honduras y ropa para niños.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 32 years old and married with two children between 3 and 5 years old. Both of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members.  Judith resides in and rents a one-room house where she is staying with ten people. There is electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala in Busega and works seven days a week.  Judith sells second hand clothes and receives at least 20 customers a day.  She buys these clothes from Owino Market and uses public transport to and from shopping. Judith doesn’t pay rent for business premises .Besides this clothing business, Judith is a teacher in one of the nearby schools. She sells to all categories of people and at both retail and wholesale. Judith has been with MCDT for five years, servicing her 10th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont  en moyenne  44 ans, 5 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt de groupe après avoir correctement remboursés tous les prêts trois  précédents. 
Elles font de la vente de condiments alimentaires,  de boissons, de poissons frais,  des fruits et légumes,  du gombo et de  la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 20 casiers de boissons, 60 kg de poissons frais, 10 sacs de légumes frais, 15 sacs de gombo frais et pour la restauration 1sac de 100 kg de riz, 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1bidon de 20 litres. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants et effectuent leurs ventes à Sikasso ville, à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant,en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin pour la vente.
texts.en:
The seven members of this Benkadi group are all married women, with an average age of 44 and on average, 5 children, and live mostly in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 4th solidarity loan. The preceding 3 loans were all correctly reimbursed. They sell condiments, drinks, fresh fish, fruit and vegetables, okra, and cooked food.

With their new loan they intend to buy 10 packets of condiments, 20 crates of drinks, 60 kg of fresh fish, 10 sacks of fresh vegetables, 15 sacks of fresh okra, and for their cooked food: 1 sack of 100 kg of rice, 3 packs of condiments, and 1 jerrycan of 20 liters of oil. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Sikasso town, out of their homes, in the various markets, and in the neighborhoods on foot, for cash, retail, and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 32,500 F CFA of which part will be put into savings or used for family needs, the rest being invested back into their businesses. They count on having more working capital so as to better satisfy their clientele and to be able to set up a sales point.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale and for cooked food production

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Todas las mujeres destinan sus créditos para el sustento de sus actividades comerciales que les permite obtener pequeños margenes de ganancias para soportar sus gastos diarios en alimento, educación de sus hijos, gastos  de salud, y para reinvertir en sus negocios.
Como veremos en la descripción de sus negocios solo dos señoras se dedican a actividades  diferentes a las demás que son chiperas, este negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo más aún para las mujeres , ya que el proceso de producción inicia generalmente a las 03:30 entre las 04:00 horas de la madrugada, preparando el horno a leña, más conocido como tatacua en la que posteriormente se introduce la masa de la chipa moldeada. Esto implica soportar un alto grado de calor manipulando el proceso de cocción  del producto mencionado  durante varias horas.
Una vez terminada el producto queda la ardua tarea de venderlas en su totalidad para que de esta única forma sea compensada el tan forzoso trabajo de las chiperas.
Todas estas  mujeres forman parte de un programa de desarrollo social y económico denominado Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras impulsado por la Fundación Paraguaya, ofreciendo a las involucradas una gama de capacitaciones por ciclo de vida del comité, y un apoyo financiero para que las mismas cuenten con un capital operativo que netamente invierten en sus respectivos negocios.
Por este hecho el Comité Santa Lucia, agradece  a la Fundación Paraguaya  y Kiva por la confianza puesta en sus personas para que de este modo las mismas puedan ir mejorando sus vidas paso a paso.

loans.use: insumos para la producción de chipa (maiz, harina, huevo, etc)

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en: Winifred A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school.  Winifred sells smoked fish at Elmina, which she has been doing since the year 2005. Her husband is a fisherman.  Winifred uses income support the husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Winifred will use the loan to buy more fish to smoke by way of processing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Winifred plans to save to further her childrens education.

loans.use: Winifred will use the loan to buy more fish to smoke by way of processing for sale.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye D. âgé de 40 ans , il s’active dans la vente de pièces détachées sur la route nationale au quartier Médine au sortir de la ville de Mbour depuis cinq (5) ans .Ce prêt lui servira a l’achat de nouveaux  produits et matériaux  de véhicule pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Il est marié, les revenus tirés de cette vente lui permettent  de faire face aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille

Margaret resides and rents a two roomed house where she staying with ten people. There is electricity and no piped water at home. Margret takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 10 customers a day. Margaret owns a pub selling beer and other soft drinks in Ntinda and sells to all categories of people.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are transportation and rent.  Margaret has been with MCDT for 10 years servicing her twentieth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and beer Margaret is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure and also build a house

loans.use: To buy crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Jiguissèmè. Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Jiguissèmè de l’association Tienkadi sont tous des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans,  4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur septième  prêt de groupe, tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font de  la vente de fruits, de poissons fumés,  de pagnes, d’orange,  de pomme de terre et de la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 paniers d’oranges, 4 sacs d’ananas, 4 régimes de banane, 45,kg de poissons fumés, 5 pièces de pagnes wax, 2 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 5 sacs de 100 kg de pomme de terre et 1sac de 100 kg de riz,  5 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 2 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe, 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire pour la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants et  vendent à Sikasso ville  dans les différents  marchés  d’une façon fixe,  au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent aider leur mari à construire un lot à usage d’habitation, mais aussi avoir  plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers pour la vente la restauration.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte O. cooks and sells red, red (a soup or stew of mashed beans).  She boils beans and fries plantain to sell at Elmina.  Charlotte has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Charlotte has been selling red, red since 2007.  Her income helps pay the school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plantain, beans and oil to use in her cooking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more plantain, beans and oil for cooking.

loans.name: Jehova Nissi Group

texts.en: Joyce is twenty – four years old. She is single and has no child. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Joyce is a hair dresser by profession. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Jehovah Nissi. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Sabali. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Sabali sont des femmes, 3 mariées  et 1 veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur septième  prêt de groupe, tous les six prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles font de  la vente de fruits,  de poissons fumés, de pagnes, d’oranges, de pomme de terre et  de la restauration  comme activités génératrices de revenus.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1 dizaine de régime de bananes, 6 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire pour la vente et 100 kg de riz,  5 sacs de 50 kg de pomme de terre, 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires pour la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville au marché de façon fixe, au comptant, quelques fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent  avoir et construire un lot à usage d’habitation.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers pour la vente et la restauration.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is thirty – two years old. She is married and has give birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. She trades in food items such as rice. She sells on a table top at the local market. She also supplies to food vendors. Diana buys bags of rice from nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. is single and has two children. She has been through high school.  Joyce sells fresh fish; she goes to the sea shore to buy fish for sale at Elmina near Botia, which she has been doing since 2004. Joyce uses her income in payment of school fees and utility bills.  Joyce will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save for her childrens education.

loans.use: Joyce will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Abibatou

texts.fr: M. Abibatou est née le 31/07/1975 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Abibatou est mariée à BANKOLE Abdel. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis trois ans à Avrotrou, un quartier de Cotonou. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Abibatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Abibatou vend des sacs de maïs qu’elle va acheter à Malanville, deuxième marché international de produits vivriers du Bénin. Mais Abibatou vend aussi des chaussures et des bijoux sur commande et à crédit. Abibatou achète les chaussures et bijoux à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Abibatou a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Abibatou a eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Abibatou demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de chaussures et bijoux.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret sells charcoal from a market stall. Charcoal is in big demand in the market and she serves about 20 people a day. She works six days a week. She incurs extra transport costs as she buys charcoal from the next township, Bwaise. The major challenges she faces in her business are transport costs and seasonality. She has been in this business for the last 10 years.

Margret is a 34-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 15 and 25 years old. She lives and works in a semi-urban area. All her children go to school. Margret rents a two-room house where she lives with all her children. There is electricity and piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day. Her major monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Margret has been with MCDT for six years working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock. Margret's aspiration is to see her business expand.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is thirty – eight years old. She is divorced and has give birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Yaa is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She sells on a table top by a road side in her community. Yaa buys bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby towns. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah has been in business for 15 years and, besides a vegetable business, she sells Irish potatoes. She works seven days a week and gets 20 customers a day. She incurs extra expenses transporting to and from suppliers in the Owino market (one of the busiest markets in Uganda). The major challenges she faces are transport costs and seasonality.

Hadjah is a 40-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 10 and 18 years. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. All her children go to school. Hadjah rents a one-room house where she lives with seven people. There is no electricity or piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah has been with MCDT for five years, now on her fifteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more vegetables and sacks of Irish potatoes. Hadjah's aspiration is seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and sacks of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Modou T. âgé de 48 ans est marié père de deux enfants. Il est vigile à vigile à Dalal Presta Bi une société de gardiennage. Ils ont une rémunération très faible pour le gardiennage. Ce prêt lui permet de mener une activité génératrice de revenus. Il va ainsi pouvoir financer la scolarité de ses enfants avec les bénéficies.
texts.en:
Modou T. is 48 years old, married and the father of two children. He is a security guard at Dalal Presta Bi, a security company. As a security guard, he receives a very meager pay. This loan allows him to have an activity that generates income. With the profit, he will be able to pay for his children' s school fees.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing in bulk and resell them at Thiès

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: A. Elisabeth est mariée à GANKPIN Martin, un chauffeur. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés qui sont les tiens. La famille réside à Kadjacomè dans la commune de Sèmè Kpodji. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Elisabeth vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Elisabeth est dans le secteur de la restauration. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Elisabeth achète ses provisions. Elisabeth a déjà quatre ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Elisabeth a eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Elisabeth demande un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de farine de manioc, riz, haricot, maïs, bidons d’huile, etc.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et a 05 personnes à sa charge, pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il a entamé en 1998 le commerce de filet qu’il revend aux pêcheurs, il a réduit son prix de vente pour vendre plus. La demande actuelle de ses clients est élevée, pour pouvoir les satisfaire convenablement, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter de la marchandise.

loans.use: Achat de filets

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Al vivienda del señor Jaime T. le está haciendo falta la elaboración de una barde alrededor de su casa ya que tiene poca seguridad para sus hijos, que son de pequeña edad y no quiere prevenir algún  accidenté. 
Don Jaime no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la barda es por eso que nos esta solicitando un préstamo y realizar la mejor lo más pronto posible y así su familia estará mas segura cuando el esté trabajando. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera como chofer de una camión de carga para una compañía de trasporte.

loans.use: Elaboración de una barda alrededor de la casa

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine wants to use this loan to buy bunches of bananas. She receives 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys in the community where she works. The major challenge she faces in her business is seasonal supply.

Justine is a 38 year single woman with three children between the ages of 10 and 18 years old. Justine doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. All her children go to school. Justine rents a two room house where she lives with four people. There is no electricity or piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Justine has with MCDT for five years, now on her fourteenth loan working with the same group mates. Justine hopes to see her business grow bigger and own a permanent business structure.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Massa

texts.fr:
Cette dame a pour activité le commerce des produits alimentaires, elle a initié ce commerce en 2000 et s’approvisionne  au marché local d’akodessewa. Etant en rupture de stock, elle souhaite augmenter son stock par l’achat de tas d’ignames, 5 bidons d’huile de 25 litres et 3 paniers moyens de poissons et divers. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. 
Elle a deux personnes à sa charge, c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’elle subvient à ces diverses charges.
texts.en:
This woman sells food products. She started the business in 2000 and buys her stock at the local market in Akodessewa. She is currently out of stock so she hopes to buy a supply of yams, five 25-litre containers of oil, three medium-sized baskets of fish and other products to restock her business. With this new stock, she will be able to increase her revenue.
She has two dependents and her business income covers her various expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yams, sweet potatoes and oil

loans.name: Tekove Pora Rekavo Group

texts.es:
Todas las mujeres destinan sus creditos para el sustento de sus actividades comerciales que les permite obtener pequeños margenes de ganancias para sostener sus gastos diarios en alimentos, educación de sus hijos, gastos  de salud, y para reinvertir en sus negocios.
Como veremos en la descripción de sus negocios, todas estas actividades requieren dedicación y mucho esfuerzo a la par de asumir riesgos altos ya que las señoras conocen básicamente la administración de un negocio.
Todas estas  mujeres forman parte de un programa de desarrollo social y económico denominado Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras impulsado por la Fundación Paraguaya , ofreciendo a las involucradas una gama de capacitaciones por ciclo de vida del comité, y un apoyo financiero para que las mismas cuenten con un capital operativo que netamente invierten en sus respectivos negocios.
Por este hecho el Comité Tekove pora rekavo , que significa `` Buscando  una vida mejor ´´agradece  a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesta en personas de status relativamente baja (que son ellas) que son discriminados en el mundo de las oportunidades hasta la actualidad, pero que aún así la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva les brinda su apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderias para la elaboración de chipa (maiz, harina, huevo,), compra de ropas para venta y frutas para la elaboración de jugos y dulce.

loans.name: Enid Nerima‘S Group

texts.en:
Enid, age 52, is the single mother of eight chidren, aged between 10 and 24 years. Four of her chidren go to school and the rest are working. Enid also takes care of additional family members. Enid and her family reside in a rented two-roomed house, which they share with two other people. There is electricity in the home but no piped water. Enid ensures that the family gets three meals a day. 

Enid resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, and she works seven days a week. Enid owns a grocery shop in Kawala, selling soap, sugar, tea leaves, and other merchandise. She buys this merchandise from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in the city of Kampala. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. The major challenges she faces in her business are seasonality and the increasing prices of merchandise as well as high transport costs and defaulters. Enid has been in this business for ten years. 

She and her group mate have been with MCDT for five years and are now requesting their tenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery shop. Enid dreams of seeing her business grow bigger and eventually owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta is twenty – seven years old. He is single and has no child. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Atta is a tailor by profession. He sews for both ladies and gents. Atta has two apprentices who are currently under training. He works in a shop by the road side in his community. Atta has been in business for five years and want a loan to buy fabrics and other working materials in bulk to expand his businesses.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: I. Fatima est née vers 1976 à Cotonou,Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Fatima est mariée à ZANMENOU Clodoué. Ce couple a à sa charge deux enfants tous scolarisés. Mais ce couple est parent de trois enfants. La famille réside depuis vingt ans à Avrotrou, un quartier de Cotonou. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Fatima vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Fatima vend à manger au carrefour Avrotrou. Fatima vend la pâte de maïs et les produits de mer (crevettes, poissons, crabes, etc.) frits ainsi que la viande frite (poulet, aileron, saucisse, etc.). C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Fatima achète ses provisions. Fatima a déjà cinq d’expérience dans cette activité. Fatima a déjà eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Fatima demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
I. Fatima is born around 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Fatima is married to ZANMENOU Clodoue. This couple takes care of two children, all in school, and they are parents of three children. For twenty years, the family has lived in Avrotrou, a neighborhood of Cotonou.Thanks to the income from her business, Fatima helps her husband with the family expenses. Fatima sells food at Avrotrou junction. She sells cooked corn dough popularly called "kenkey" ( a local food usually eaten with fried fish or meat and pepper sauce) and sea products (shrimps, fish, crabs etc.), fries as well as fried meat ( chicken, chicken wings, sausage, etc.). Fatima buys her supplies at Dantokpa, the big international market of Benin. She already has five years experience in this business and had before four loans from ALIDE that she repaid correctly and with which she was able to raise the level of her business. To continue to expand her business , Fatima is requesting a fifth loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn, gallons of oil, sea products, etc.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 35 years married with two children aged between 3and 15 years All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Harriet resides and rents three roomed house where she is staying with four people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.Harriet owns a drug shop in Kampala city.  She buys these.  She uses public transport to and from work.  She sells to all categories of people .Harriet has been with MCDT for four year servicing her eigth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more drugs and syrups  Harriet is aspiring of owning a fully refurnished hospital .

loans.use: to buy more medicines for her drug shop

loans.name: Rejina

texts.es:
la sra. REJINA I. se dedica a la pasteleria y reposteria desde hace 3 años, trabaja solo por encargos, y tambien se dedica a la venta de Golosinas como ser: tacos, Enchiladas, Pastelitos, palomitas de maíz y refrescos, en la zona de Villa Santa de donde es ella, son pocas las personas que se dedican a este tipo de negocios, y doña rejina es la persona que mas demanda tiene de su producto, ya que los clientes quedan satisfechos con los pasteles que ella elabora por el sabor que les da; rejina es casada y su esposo se dedica a la Caficultura, tienen un hijo que depende a un 100% de ellos, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio contribuye a su esposo para el sosten de la 
familia y arreglos de la casa. 
ya que gracias a ello sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
necesita el credito para comprar mas ingredientes para realizar sus pasteles y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y salir adelente con su familia.

loans.use: compra de huevos, manteca, margarina, azucar, jalea, material para decorar, harina de trijo, cajas para pasteles, levadura, soda, colorantes y saborizantes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José C. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos pequeños a los cuales les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Les está construyendo sus cuartos pero le está haciendo falta el techo y el desea colocarlo de concreto ya que es mas duradero y seguro, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder terminar la recamaras de sus  niños y portal motivo nos está solicitando un préstamo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabaja como encargado del departamento de donaciones (como es ropa, despensa, muebles etcétera)  de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.

loans.use: Losa de concreto en parte trasera de la casa

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Isabel O. con 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos que se queda con la hermana mayor en la casa mientras ella se  va a vender el Tereré (bebida típica de nuestro país) en La Plaza Uruguaya por la mañana y por la tarde tiene ventas de Tele Bingo (un juego de azar) que sale en compañía de su hijo menor. 

Isabel es una señora muy sacrificada que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa.   

Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precarios. De esta manera ella sostiene a su familia es una señora luchadora para sobre llevar con todos los gastos. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo realizan diversas actividades comerciales, el detalle es el siguiente:

De La Paz O.	Venta de helados
Clementina D.	Venta de merceria
Ana Maria W.	Venta de Avon
Isabel O.	Vta  de Terere
Felicia M.	Venta de Ropas

Blanca R.	Venta de frutas 
Francisca G.	Venta de comestible
Nimia T.	Venta de empanadas
Vicenta M.	Venta de ropas
Epifania G.	Modista
Edith L.	Vta de ropas
Lina Maria R.	Venta de Tele Bingo
Juana L.	Venta de Quiniela
Juliana M.	Despensa
Juana T.	Vta de cosmeticos
texts.en:
This group is in its third loan cycle. We can speak of Isabel O. who is 40 years old. Isabel has 3 children who remain at her older sister’s house while she goes to the Uurguaya Plaza in the mornings to sell Tereré (a traditional Paraguayan beverage); in the evenings she sells Tele Bingo (a lottery game) and her youngest son accompanies her. Isabel is a woman that has sacrificed a lot and endures very hard days because when she arrives home from work she then has to also take care of household chores. She has a small house made from unstable materials. She supports her family in this way, and works hard to be able to manage all the expenses. The other group members run diverse businesses, detailed as follows: De La Paz O. Ice cream sales Clementina D. Sewing wares sales Ana Maria W. Avon products sales Isabel O. Sale of Tereré (a traditional Paraguayan beverage) Felicia M. Clothing sales Blanca R. Fruit sales Francisca G. Food sales Nimia T. Empanada sales Vicenta M. Clothing sales Epifania G. Fashion designer Edith L. Clothing sales Lina Maria R. Sale of Tele Bingo (a lottery game) Juana L. Quiniela sales (sports lottery) Juliana M. Small grocery store Juana T. Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The requested loan will be used to purchase assorted merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Julia Vanessa

texts.es:
Julia Vanessa Rodríguez V. es socia del Banco Comunal  Dapreydi  en el cantón Tosagua de la Provincia de Manabí. Vive en compañía de su abuelita Bartola desde muy niña, juntas han compartido grandes momentos su abuelita la poya en todo lo que hace.

Julia es  estudiante de parvularia de la universidad Laica de Tosagua  está por terminar sus estudios le falta un año y sin embargo ya está  ejerciendo su carrera, ahora mismo está brindando ayuda a niños de un jardín de la localidad.

Julia es una joven  dedicada a la cría de pollos, ella tiene una pequeña granja en un terreno que le  prestó un familiar. Tiene un aproximado de 50 pollos de incubadora y gallinas criollas, ella cría y luego los vende en pie a los comerciantes del pueblo, el proceso de criar los pollos dura tres meses y  están listos para  la venta. Nos comenta que se siente feliz con su negocio  y le deja buenas ganancias.

El crédito que está solicitando a la fundación es para invertir en su negocio comprando  más  pollos, vitaminas, alimento como maíz, balanceado y más productos necesarios para la crianza de sus aves e incrementar la granja.

El sueño de Julia  es  tener su propio jardín de infantes,  sin dejar de lado la  granja que es su mayor esfuerzo  fruto de su trabajo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Julia Vanessa Rodríguez V. is a member of the Dapreydi Community Bank in Tosagua, province of Manabí, Ecuador. She has lived with her grandmother since she was very young and together they have shared many great moments. Her grandmother supports her in everything she does. Julia is studying preschool education at the secular university of Tosagua and even though she doesn't finish for a year, she is already putting her education to work. Right now she is caring for kids at a local nursery school.

Julia makes a living raising chickens. She has a small farm on some land a relative lent to her. She has approximately 50 chickens and hens, which she raises and then sells to the towns merchants. The process of raising the chickens takes three months and then they are ready to sell. She tells us that she feels proud of her business and she makes good profits. The loan she is requesting is to invest in the purchase of more chickens, as well as vitamins, food and other products to help raise the birds and expand her business. Julia's dream is to have her own nursery school, without leaving behind the farm that has been the source of her greatest effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, as well as vitamins, food and other products to help raise the birds and expand her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Norma es soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Norma vende frutas de manera ambulatoria en un triciclo, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Norma se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdos y gallinas.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas y alimentos para los animales.
Los sueños de Norma son construir su casa y ahorrar mas.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of Lila Community Bank. She is a 34-year-old single mother of two children. She sells fruits outdoors from her tricycle, an activity she carries out every day. Furthermore, Norma also makes a living raising livestock such as pigs and hens. She is requesting a loan of 1400 soles (approximately $500), which she plans to invest in the purchase of fruits and feed for her animals. Norma's dreams are to build her own home and to save more.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit as well as feed for her livestock

loans.name: Yovany

texts.es:
Yovany es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Yovany es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Yovany se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos como biscochos, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza a pedido y también envía a la ciudad de Lima.
Yovany necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, coco y canela.
Los sueños de Yovany son que sus hijas sean profesionales y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Yovany is a member of the Lila Communtiy Bank. She is a 36-year-old married mother of two children. Yovany makes a living making typical bread products such as biscuits, an activity she carries out from an oven she rents. Her sales are by order and she also sends her products to the city of Lima. Yovany is requesting a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $700), which she plans to invest in the purchase of flour, coconut and cinnamon. Yovany's dreams are for her children to be successful and to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, coconut and cinnamon

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Modesta es casada, tiene 57 años y 4 hijos, Modesta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. animales bebes como pato, pollos para crianza, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Modesta necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pollos.
Los sueños D. Modesta son construir su casa.

loans.use: Para la compra de pollos.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Cette femme est une couturière de formation,  elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a ouvert son atelier non loin du marché d’adawlato. Avec son revenu, elle contribue aux dépenses familiales. La qualité de ses services fait qu’elle est très connue dans son quartier. Les outils nécessaires à son activité étant épuisés, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 4 nouvelles machines à coudre et des doublures.
texts.en:
This woman is a dressmaker by training. She is married and the mother of two children. She opened her shop not far from the market in Adawlato. With her revenue she helps cover her family’s expenses. The quality of her work has made her well-known in her neighbourhood. Given that the tools she needs for her business are worn out, she is requesting a loan through WAGES to buy four new sewing machines and some lining material.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing machines and thread

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
el grupo la Amistad son mujeres muy trabajadoras, se caracterizan por tener una actitud positiva y tambien tienen muchos deseos de superarse en esta vida. 
a continuacion se detalla las actividades que ellas realizan;
la sra. REINA MARCELINA M.: se dedica al comercio y su negocio es la venta de pan , frijoles y goloisinas tambien siembra granos basicos tales como ser maiz , frijoles y café. Durante todo este tiempo ha sabido administrar su negocio lo que le ha permitido salir adelante. doña Marcelina se ha 
esforzado para salir adelante a pesar que todos sus hijos ya no dependen de ella pues ya estan casados pero se ha esmerado para dejarles un patrimonio a sus hijos y sobre todo un buen ejemplo de trabajo y superacion.
la sra. MERCEDES DEL CARMEN M.: Ella  elabora y vende golosinas tales como nacatamales , tamalitos , paletas, tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad economica la que le genera ingresos para cubrir sus compromisos financieros y contribuir en parte en los gastos del hogar , de esta manera doña Mercedes apoya a su esposo Guillermo que se dedica a la agricultura solo tiene una hija que depende de ellos y cursa la secundaria pues los demas trabajan.
Mercedes se siente muy motivada y esto le permite seguir esforzandose para salir adelante 
la sra. SANTOS RAYMUNDA G. L. : se dedica al comercio cuenta con una pulperia donde vende 
productos de consumo de la canasta basica familiar tiene mas de un año de haber instalado su pequeño negocio ya que  anteriormente vendia golosinas tales como nacatamales , tacos y enchiladas , el cambio de negocio le ha dado gran beneficio porque vende diariamente y le genera mayor rentabilidad, esto le permite obtener mejores ganancias. 
su esposo cultiva y vende hortalizas es una pareja muy activa ya que se esfuerzan mutuamente para sacar  adelante  a su familia, forman parte de su familia dos hijos el niño mayor a Temprana edad le diagnosticaron Diabetes y tiene que estar con un tratamiento medico a doña munda como se le conoce en la aldea su negocio le genera ingresos para estar al cuidado de su hijo ya que esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.

loans.use: compra de carnes de res, pollo y cerdo , harina de maiz, vegetales, tortillas, quesos, mantequilla, manteca, aceite, jabones, salsas,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Luisa es casada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Luisa venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijas.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa.
Los sueños D. Luisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y su negocio crezca.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Juana es soltera, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Juana viaja a las ferias llevando panes y de las ferias compra cereales, animales menores.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y su negocio se amplíe.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar.

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es:
El señor Lauro P. tiene ya mas de tres años con su negocio de venta de comida preparada. 
Su negocio está ubicado en la carretera salida a Nuevo Laredo. Este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que tiene tres hijos y les quiere dar lo mejor.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta un congelador más grande, le está ofreciendo uno a muy buen precio pero no cuenta con el dinero para poder adquirirlo, es por eso que solicita el préstamo y así poder comprar el congelador que le están ofreciendo.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Lauro P. has operated his own business, selling prepared foods, for more than three years. His business is located at the highway exit for Nuevo Laredo. This activity provides the income for his family; he has three children and he wants to provide the best he can for them. The business he is operating needs a larger freezer, and he has been offered one for a very good price. However, he does not have the money to buy it. For this reason, he is asking for a loan in order to purchase the freezer that is being offered to him. He plans to repay the loan with the profits from his business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a freezer

loans.name: Three Sisters Group

texts.en:
Here are Fatmata L., Marian K. and Edeline B.. They call their group Three Sisters. Members of the Three Sisters group are small scale businesswomen in Makeni city. They have been very fortunate to receive several Kiva loans. These loans have improved the businesses and living standards of these entrepreneurs. The previous loan they received was for Le 1,000,000.00 each. Having repaid that successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to further improve their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata L. on the right. Fatmata was born in Freetown. She is now forty-three years old, married to a police officer and they have five children. Fatmata’s children are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells drinks and locally dyed clothes called gara lappers. She has been in this business for many years now. With this loan, she will be able to further expand her business, make enough profit to cater for her children especially in meeting their educational needs.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Blima

texts.fr: Cette dame est très connue dans son quartier de Kégué à Lomé ; parce qu'elle est spécialisée dans la vente de tubercules de bonne qualité (les ignames) et le maïs. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2004. Elle s’approvisionne à Atakpamé, ville située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Grâce à ce commerce, elle apporte son aide financière à son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants ; de plus, elle réalise ses propres projets par ce commerce, ce qui fait qu’elle a toujours l’estime et le respect de son mari. Elle vend aussi ses ignames à des revendeuses dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé, ce qui fait qu’elle arrive toujours à vite écouler ses stocks. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 10 paniers d’ignames et 15 sacs de maïs ; le reste du prêt servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers Atakpamé.
texts.en:
This woman is well known in her Kégué neighborhood in Lomé, because she is specialized in the sale of good quality tubers of yam and corn. She began this business since 2004. She gets her supplies at Atakpamé, a town located about 12 kilometers from Lomé. Thanks to this business, she provides financial support to her husband for the education of their children. In addition, she carries out her own projects through this trade which makes her to always have the honor and respect from her husband. She also sells her yams to retailers in the market of Hédzranawoé in Lomé that makes her always arrive early to sell off her stock. Currently, she need to replenish her stock and it is for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 10 baskets of yam and 15 bags of corn. The remaining loan will be used to cover transport cost to Atakpamé.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yams and bags of corn

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Luzmila es casada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Luzmila junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de bellos tejidos en telares, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de 9 personas, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Lima y también una feria en EE.UU.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos.
Los sueños de Luzmila son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener mas capital y exportar mas sus productos.

loans.use: Para la compra de hilos.

loans.name: Mirna Yolanda

texts.es:
la sra. MIRNA YOLANDA J. se dedica al comercio, vende ropa para dama, caballero y niños como ser pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, ropa interior, trajesitos, calsonetas, calcetines etc. el producto lo vende de manera ambulante en diferentes comunidades circunvecinas a Villa Santa y tambien vende en su casa de habitación,  tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y desde que inicio con el negocio su condición de vida a mejorado en gran manera,  vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos.
Su compañero de hogar es contratista de madera y aserrador de la misma, ya que esta es una zona 
con abundante bosque de pino.
Doña Mirna, expresa sentirse muy agradecida ya que todo por los momentos le esta saliendo y esta vendiendo mucha mercaderia, por tal razon desea un credito y asi comprar mas ropa al por mayor ya qye las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas y desea complacer a todos.

loans.use: compra de ropa para dama, caballero y niños

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es:
Cesarea es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Cesarea es casada, tiene 43 años y 8 hijos, Cesarea tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Cesarea necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Cesarea son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Celia Deysi

texts.es: Celia Deysi R. A. reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Celia tiene 40 años de edad es madre soltera, su única hija se llama Deysi con 16 años de edad estudiante de bachillerato. Celia no recibe el apoyo económico de nadie, por si sola ha sacado adelante a su hija, quien es el motivo del día a día en la vida de Celia, el negocio que maneja es una tienda , venta de tortillas y pupusas, por la cual hoy solicita este crédito, ya que desea surtir su tienda y comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para su pupuseria y tortillería.
texts.en:
Celia Deysi R. A. lives in Apopa, a neighborhood in the city of San Salvador. Celia is 40 years old and is a single mother. Her only daughter, Deysi, is 16 years old and studies in high school. Celia does not receive economic assistance from anybody; she alone has worked to help her daughter get ahead. Celia's daughter is her day to day motivation. Her business is working in a store, selling tortillas and pupusas. For this reason she is asking for the loan, as she desires to stock her store and buy a greater quantity of ingredients for her tortilla and pupusa making.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store and buy ingredients for her products

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es: María Elizabeth S. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. María tiene 47 años de edad, vive solamente con sus dos hijas Lisseth de 13 años de edad y Graciela de 6 años de edad, el esposo de María se encuentra en estados unidos, trabajando para poderle dar lo mejor a su familia. María es una mujer muy trabajadora a pesar de contar con el apoyo de su esposo ella no ha dejado su negocio, en el cual son ya veinte años de experiencia; el negocio de María consta de la venta de productos personales como desodorantes, cremas corporales, perfumes, entre otros. El crédito que solicita María es para surtir su inventario de productos.

loans.use: Surtir su inventario

loans.name: Celia Faustina

texts.es:
La socia Celia; pertenece al banco comunal, TAMBOPATA DE TIPON; ubicado en el distrito de Oropeza, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis, en el departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo y alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio minorista, ella cría animales menores (específicamente el cuy), la socia tiene cuyes al por mayor y los vende al por mayor y menor, ella se encarga de la compra, alimentación, cuidado de su salud y la venta final de estos. Nuestra socia desea el préstamo para reinvertir en su pequeño negocio y así mejorarlo y un aparte para probar en comprar aves de corral.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Aurelia es casada, tiene 37 años y 7 hijos, Aurelia vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores, además los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias en donde vende ropa.
Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y ropa.
Los sueños de Aurelia son que su negocio crezca y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de leña y ropa.

loans.name: Living Waters Group

texts.en: Abena is fifty – nine years old. She is widowed and has seven children. She lives with her some of her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Abena is a trader. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Living Waters. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To bu y stock

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. PETRONA DEL CARMEN L. se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación con ayuda de sus hijas, su producto lo distribuye en diferentes negocios de la zona
