Asimismo preparaba en casa tamales los fines D. semana; lo que también tuvo pequeñas ganancias Por un tiempo dejó D. vender debido a la recaída D. su último hijo con síndrome D. down, retomando poco tiempo en el negocio pero ahora D. cervezas, ventas que hasta momento ha sido rentable. 
Necesita el préstamo invertir una parte en cerveza y la diferencia comprar una vitrina y vasos, porque posteriormente quiere volver abrir el kiosco y seguir apoyando a su familia.

Libia O. R. venD. D. manera ambulatoria frutas, gaseosas, refrescos, sándwiches que ella misma prepara en casa, sus productos los coloca en una cesta y los ofrece a los pasajeros y turistas que se estacionan por unos minutos en el control (peaje) D. Corcona, para continuar luego su camino por el centro del Perú. Las ventas D. estos productos lo invierte una parte en la carrera superior a su mayor hijo que estudia mantenimiento D. máquinas pesadas y el resto del crédito en la alimentación para sus hijos. El crédito que necesita es para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
CORCONA CORAZÓN: This group was formed in May 2005. Since that time, the ten members have received loans that have helped to improve their businesses, with the goal of improving their quality of life. The group’s treasurer, Grace R. A., decided four years ago to start selling groceries from her home. She did this with money that her husband gave her. She saved it up to buy two sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 case of cooking oil, 1 case of canned food, and 1 package of noodles to start a grocery store. She has had some ups and downs with this business, but Grace’s administrative skills caused her business to grow. Because of this she was able to improve her house, finish educating her children in school, and get her oldest son started in a technical degree program. Grace and her husband decided to invest in a vehicle that they rent out so that they can continue to generate additional income. They were able to do this with loans that they obtained from EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD plus her husband’s income as a driver and the income from the store. Her goal is to continue educating her youngest child, who is four years old. She also wants to build a future for her old age, since she doesn’t have a pension. She needs the loan to continue running and improving her store. Arsenia R. C. D. Orozco is 58 years old and the mother of eight children, 3 of whom are still dependant on her. Her husband’s income as a locksmith wasn’t enough, so she decided to sell cookies, sweets, soft drinks, and sandwiches from a rented kiosk, with the goal of covering expenses for her large family. She also prepared tamales at home on the weekends, which also provided her with some small income. She quit selling for a while due to an illness of her youngest son, who has Down syndrome. She is now selling again but now she sells beer, which has been profitable so far. She wants to invest part of her loan in buying more beer and she’ll use the remainder to buy a display case and glasses, because she wants to eventually open the kiosk again and continue supporting her family. Libia Orozco R. is a street vendor of fruits, soft drinks, fruit drinks, and sandwiches that she prepares at home. She puts her products in a basket and offers them to passers-by and tourists that park for a few minutes at the toll gate in Corcona before continuing their trip through central Peru. She invests part of her earnings in tuition for her oldest son, who is studying heavy equipment maintenance, and the rest in food for her children. She needs the loan to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Mrs. Felicidad S.'s journey started way back in her childhood. She learned her trade from her parents who were ginamos makers. In 1955, when she was still a teenager, she started buying fresh krill and making her own ginamos. She sold her products in nearby towns by setting up a stand in each town's market during market day. She continued her ambulatory business even after she got married and, by then, she already had a few regular customers who came to her house to buy her ginamos.

Because she wanted to expand her business, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 to access additional capital. She put her entire first loan into her business and she got very good returns on her investment. For the past 15 years, while she's been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has maintained her good credit standing by paying her loans on time and attending the center meetings. As her business prospered, Felicidad expanded her product lines. She now also sells asin (sea salt) and coconut wine called tuba. She earns an average monthly net income of 16,000 pesos from her business activities, and this has been a big help in defraying the family's expenses, with enough left over to pay for the education of her children in previous years. She was also able to renovate her house with her savings.

Mrs. Felicidad S. is a 69-year-old married woman with six adult children ranging in age from 31 to 42 years old. She is from Brgy. Canjusa, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. By sheer will and determination, she was able to send all of her children to school to earn their college degrees. All of them now have their own families and are gainfully employed. Their achievements have made Felicidad very proud and, for her, she has already attained her life's dream – according to her, all because she had NWTF-Project Dungganon for support all these years.

Felicidad is a businesswoman with good entrepreneurial instincts who seeks new opportunities so that she can provide her family with financial security. Now she wants to borrow 12,000 pesos for her 15th loan cycle to use mainly as additional working capital for her ginamos business and the rest for her sea salt and coconut wine ventures.

A little about ginamos, asin and tuba: "Ginamos" is a generic Hiligaynon (the local dialect in the Western Visayas Islands) term for anything that is salted and allowed to ferment. But when referring to other salted products, it is qualified by adding the item that was salted. For example, salted duck's eggs are called ginamos nga itlog, salted fish is called ginamos nga isda, and salted mussels are called ginamos nga tahong. When the term "ginamos" is used alone, it usually refers to the pasty product made from minute shrimp-like crustaceans (possibly pacific krill) that are salted, dried and pounded into a paste. Ginamos is known as "bagoong" in Tagalog, although some of the processing steps are a bit different and the taste is also a bit different. Negrenses pride themselves on being the makers of the best ginamos in the country, and Pulupandan is one of the towns that has the tradition and recipe handed down for several generations. Ginamos is used as a flavor enhancer in a lot of Filipino dishes, but it is also a dish in itself. It is usually cooked by adding coconut vinegar and sauteed with lots of crushed garlic and a little bit of sugar to balance the saltiness. Sometimes fried pork rind is added to make it even more special. It is usually served with green mangoes or as a side dish for kare-kare, a Filipino dish made with oxtail or beef cooked in a peanut sauce with vegetables.

Asin, or sea salt, is made by sun drying sea water on shallow flats until the liquid evaporates and salt crystals appear. Once the salt bed is dry, the salt crystals are gathered and packed into sacks for distribution. Sea salt remains the preferred flavor enhancer in many Negrense kitchens, because many cooks contend that sea salt packs a better flavor than the fine iodized table salt sold in groceries.

Tuba, or coconut wine, is made, not from coconut water inside the coconut, but rather by "wounding" the unopened flower clusters and collecting the sweet sap drops into a container. The flower clusters are usually lacerated early in the morning to get the sweeter sap, and the containers are usually gathered in the afternoon just in time for the men to arrive home from work. The slightly alcoholic beverage makes a refreshing drink after a hard day in the fields. If the tuba is not consumed within the day, it is kept in glass bottles in a cool dark place to ferment into vinegar. Like balsamic vinegar, tuba vinegar improves with age. Tuba vinegar is one of the most fragrant and flavorful vinegars in the Philippines.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Capital for ginamos, sea salt and coconut wine businesses

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La señora Estela A. de 38 años de edad, vende ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, desde hace siete años, el cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo que dio dinero para que comenzara sus ventas y pudiera iniciar su objetivos, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, con un hijo de 14 años de edad, que curso su año escolar. Este es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic  el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y otros mas para construir un cuarto el cual ocupara para alquiler y tener otros ingresos que serán de mucha ganancias para su familia. La idea surgió ya que muchos estudiantes de los departamentos alquilan cuarto y son jóvenes con deseo de superación que vienen a la capital a concluir su carrera. A futuro espera invertir más en el negocio de ropa y la captación de más clientes. Agradece a la institución por los préstamos obtenidos que han sido de muchos beneficios y prosperacion de su famita.
texts.en:
Estela A. is 38 years old and she has been selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for the past seven years. She began the business with money that her husband gave her to so that she could start her sales. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city, Managua, with her 14 year-old son, who is in school. This is her ninth loan cycle with Afodenic and she will buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement, steel, and others, which she will use to build a room that she will rent out, which will mean additional income that will be very useful for the family. The idea came to her because many students from other departments rent rooms when they come to the capital to complete their education. In the future she hopes to invest more in her clothing business and attract more customers. She is grateful to the institution for the loans she has received, which have been beneficial to the prosperity of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, steel, and other construction materials

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El señor Cirilo H. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito y con el cual pudo surtir su carrito de venta de tacos.
Ahora esta nuevamente solicitando otro préstamo para acondicionar y surtir un nuevo carrito para la venta de tacos y así mismo ayudar a otra persona en darle un trabaja. 
Don Cirilo planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de sus venta de tacos ya que con el nuevo carrito será para los gastos familiares y pagarle a la persona que contratara para que le ayude a la venta.
texts.en:
Mr. Cirilo Hernandez is very thankful for you help with the previous loan, which he used to supply his taco sales cart. Now, he requests a new loan to set up and supply a new cart for taco sales and this way also help another person by giving them a job. Mr. Cirilo plans to repay the loan with the earnings that he gets from his taco sales because the new cart earnings will be used to pay for family expenses and to pay the person he will hire to help him out with the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply a new cart for taco sales

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. sells smoked fish; she buys fish from the fishermen to smoke at Elmina Kumasi.  Victoria has no educational background.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Victoria has been selling smoked fish since 2005. She supports the husband in the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to help further the childrens education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process for sale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort N. is married and has five dependants. She has no educational background.  Comfort sells smoked fish at castle near nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 2005. Comfort uses her income to support the husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more smoke fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, comfort plans to save to increase her capital.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more smoke fish to sell.

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es: La señora  Argentina Azucena de 46 años  de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, madre soltera de 6 hijos, tres mayores trabajan y son independientes y tres están a su cargo y que estudian para tener un vida social mejor, su negocio es el acarreo  en un carretón con caballos, al día hace de 9 a 12 viajes, de diferentes viajes como acarreo de bloques, verduras, frutas, madera a si como votar basura todo que le genere ingresos, lleva siete años es este negocio, con este préstamo es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic, el cual invertirá en compra de caballo chuscarro, para domesticarlo y engordarlo y venderlo a mejor precio. Sus planes es poder ampliar su acarreo con otra jabalina y que generen mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de caballo chucarro para reforzar su trabajo y vender

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric A. sells video cassettes, music videos, and other CDs and DVDs at Castle near Nyankumasi.  Eric has received a senior high school education.  He is married and has two children. His wife is a trader. Eric has been selling video cassettes since 2005. He is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more videos, CDs, and DVDs to sell. He hopes to use the new profits to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more videos, CDs, and DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is married and has six dependents. She has received a junior high school education.  Rose sells mattresses and linoleum flooring at Castle near Nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 2001. Her husband is a trader. Rose uses her income to help pay fees and utility bills.  Rose will use the loan to buy more mattresses to sell. Rose plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate the children.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine S. is a married woman with two young children, ages 5 and 11, who lives in the village of Brgy. Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. At 29 years old, she is a young entrepreneur who is proving that it is possible to break the cycle of poverty if you just give it your best shot. She started her business from nothing and now she knows that she has found the right path to achieving her hopes and dreams - to have her own fishing boat and save enough for her children's future.

Before she started her business, Geraldine's husband worked as a helper at a construction site, earning the minimum daily wage, which was not nearly enough to meet the needs of their family. At the time, Geraldine was herself unemployed, and was totally dependent on her husband's take home pay, which he turned over to her so that she could budget for their expenses. That was fine while it was just them, but when she became pregnant with her first child, she realized that if she did not take the initiative, her children might grow up to be construction workers just like their father, or unemployed like her, and continue to be poor.

This realization motivated her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 to access the much needed capital to start her own business. She used her first loan to buy basic fishing equipment and went to work. At times, when her husband had no construction work, they both went fishing. The income was good and she was able to save enough to purchase a motorized boat and employ a helper. Aside from her fishing business, she was also able to start raising pigs. She earns an average monthly net income of 3,000 pesos from her ventures. Her previous loan of 7,000 pesos was used as additional capital for her business, and was paid in full on time. She is now borrowing 9,000 pesos on her eighth loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon to add capital to her pig-raising business. She intends to save her earnings for the future security of her children.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additonal capital for her piggery business

loans.name: Yulya

texts.en:
Yulya is married with a 4-year-old daughter Margarita. She is an entrepreneur from Stryi where she runs a business selling flowers and accessories in a small floral store. She launched this small enterprise about 2 years ago because she loves plants and seeks to make this world a more beautiful place. Currently, she gets about 20,000 Grivnyas in gross income each month. 

Yulya is requesting a loan of 14,500 Grivnyas to increase her working capital and sales as a result. She is hoping to buy a batch of handmade cards and additional vases to sell them as retail items in her little store along with a variety of flowers. Yulya is hoping to make some savings and eventually go on a tour to Prague, Czech Republic which has been her dream for a long time.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Eben

texts.en:
Eben O. B. is married and has one child. He has senior high school education. His wife is a trader.

Eben sells groceries such as milk, Milo (a milk beverage), sugar, canned meat and fish, oil, bottled water, and so on, at Castle near Nyankumasi which he has been doing since 2004. He uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills.

Eben will use the loan to buy more rice, sugar, milk, and so on, for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to save to increase his business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en: Edmond D. D. sells groceries such as biscuits, toffees, Milo, milk, sugar, oil and so on near Nyankumasi.  Edmond, who has no educational background, is married to a trader and has three children.  A groceries-seller since 2004, he is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills and will use his loan to buy more groceries to sell. Edmond hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand his enterprise.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy T., who has no educational background, is married and has three children. She has been selling plastic containers, buckets, ice chests and so on near Nyankumasi since 2002.  Nancy, who uses her income to support  her husband in the payment of utility bills, will use the loan to purchase more plastic containers for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to further expand her enterprise.

loans.use: Nancy will use the loan to purchase more plastic containers for sale.

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Zenzontle está formado por Elba Rosa Sandoval de 43 años de edad, quien es la coordinadora del grupo; María Teresa L. de 56 años; Milagros F. H. de 45 años y Alma C. L. de 37 años. Todas provenientes de la ciudad de Masaya, del barrio San Jerónimo.

Doña Elba posee una pulpería, la cual ha podido forjar gracias a los créditos que ha tenido con ADIM, es su noveno ciclo de crédito y se siente muy agradecida ya que gracias al negocio que ha podido edificar, tiene la esperanza de terminar de educar a su hijo de 16 años, a quien quiere darle un futuro mejor.

Maria L. trabaja en la Venta de Frutas y comida en su casa de habitación; Milagros F. trabaja en la venta de productos artesanos como los son hamacas y Alma C. trabaja en la compra/venta de pan.

loans.use: Invertir en el crecimiento

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya is a single Mom. She raises her daughter herself. She works hard to ensure decent livelihood for her small family. Ibolya started her small trade 10 years ago when second hand sales business was only getting started in Ukraine. Today she has a nice kiosk selling second hand items and getting about 7,000 Grivnyas of income each month. She has about 60,000 Grivnyas in merchandise. 

This time Ibolya is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is hoping to re-stock her kiosk and make more profit this season ensuring stable income for the family for upcoming winter season.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: El señor Teodoro M. de 67 años de edad, casado con cuatro hijos que su esposa le tiene, mayores e independiente, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte, su negocio es la venta de tomate, chiltoma, cebolla y otros productos, tiene doce años en estas ventas, las dificultades que se le presenta es cuando se escasea o se eleva el precio de los productos perecedero las ventas son bajas y hasta pierde los productos, es por eso los préstamo que ha hecho en Afodenic han venido a fortalecer sus ventas y agrandar mas su venta de verduras, con este préstamo comprara bastante tomate, cebolla, chiltoma para vender mas y obtener mejores ganancias. El tiene una camioneta donde hace las compra o hace también hace  acarreo para ayudarse en su economía. Agradece a la institución  por el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Teodoro M. is 67 years old, is married and has four children with his wife, all of whom are grown and independent. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. His business is selling tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, and other products. He has been in this business for twelve years. The difficulty that he has is when perishable products are scarce and the price goes up, sales are low and he can suffer product loss. The loans he has obtained from Afodenic have strengthened and expanded his sales of vegetables. With this loan he will buy a large quantity of tomatoes and bell peppers to increase his sales and improve his income. He has a pick-up truck that he uses to buy his products, and he also uses it for transport for extra income. He thanks the institution for the financing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, and bell peppers in large quantities to improve his sales

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth D. sells groceries such as milk, Milo, various kinds of spices, small sacks of rice and so on at castle near the market.  Elizabeth has received junior high school education.  She is married and has four children. Elizabeth has been selling groceries since 1988. She is responsible for paying supports the husband in the payment of utility bills. Her loan will be used to more groceries to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to increase her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Mrs. Luzviminda G., from Sitio Napulo Brgy. Cervantes, Escalante City, is 46 years old, married, and the mother of six adult children. Due to abject poverty she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and started her business with capital of PHP 3,000 which she borrowed from the project in 2002. She and her husband bought a small banca (a wooden boat with outriggers) and ventured into fishing. They deliver their catch to their regular clients.

Now, Luz is planning to use the PHP 15,000 loan she is applying for the repair of the fishing boat and the nets. They plan to save their profits so that they can buy another pumpboat - or motorized outrigger - to expand their fishing venture.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a mere $1 a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Motor boat and fishing net repair

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is married and has five dependents. She has received senior high school education. Her husband is a trader.

Elizabeth sells various kinds of paints, turpentine, sandpaper, nails and spare parts at Castle near Nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 1989. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of utility bills.

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more nails, paints and other building materials for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans save to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase more nails, paints and other building materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort G. is married and has three children. She has no educational background.  Comfort sells various kinds of soaps such as bar soap, sunlight, tooth brush and liquid soap near Nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a station master.  Comfort uses her income to support the husband in the payment of utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to add her capital to increase her business.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, who is married, runs a small business selling children’s clothing in the central marketplace of her home town of Vinogradovo. In business now for four years, she has 35,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her income is about 5,000 Grivnyas a month.

Marina is seeking a 12,500 Grivnya loan to increase her working capital and sales. Her small enterprise has been characterized by stable growth and development, and she doesn’t want to stop expanding her business, hoping to open one more vending location in the near future.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Yo Tengo Fe Group

texts.es:
Dulce María T. J. de 38 años de edad, es la coordinadora del Grupo Yo tengo Fe. Quien posee un taller de sastrería muy humilde pero de gran calidad en cuanto a los productos que elabora.

Desde hace 15 años, Dulce aprendió este oficio, trabajando en un taller como operaria. Cuando sintió que poseía la capacidad para hacerlo sola, con la ayuda de su familia (Sus hijos de 19 y 22 años y su esposo). Tomaron la decisión de poner un taller propio donde trabajaran y salieran adelante con sus conocimientos.

Actualmente su meta es lograr la adquisición de maquinas industriales y sustituir algunas de pedales que posee. Su negocio lo inicio con capital propio y aunque tuvo que enfrentar el hecho de que con la crisis económica en honduras perdió más de 14,000 córdobas en mercadería que exportaba, con sus ahorros y disciplina hoy ha alcanzado recuperarse de esta pérdida.

Darling T. trabaja en la compra de frutas y verduras en Masaya para luego llevarla a vender ha Matagalpa, cuando viene de regreso trae frijoles para venderlos en Masaya y así incrementar sus ingresos. Lorenzo posee un vivero donde compra y vende plantas.
texts.en:
Dulce María T. J. is 38 years old and the coordinator for the group “Yo Tengo Fe” (I Have Faith). She owns a modest tailoring shop where she manufactures high quality products.

Fifteen years ago, Dulce learned her trade working as a seamstress at a textile factory. When she decided to work on her own, she had the support of her family (her husband and children, ages 22 and 19). They made the decision to build Dulce her own workshop where she could use her knowledge to get ahead.

Today her goal is to acquire industrial machines and replace the pedals on her existing equipment. She started her business with her own money. Due to the economic crisis in Honduras, she recently lost 14,000 Nicaraguan córdobas on merchandise she exported (due to the exchange rates). Through saving and discipline, she has been able to recover from that loss.

Darling T. buys fruits and vegetables in Masaya and sells them in Matagalpa. She brings back with her beans that she sells in Masaya in order to increase her earnings. Lorenzo owns a nursery where he buys and sells plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to fulfill customer orders

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. is married and has one child. She has been through senior high school.  Josephine sells already made dresses, shoes and local fabrics at castle near Nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 1989. Her husband is a driver.  Josephine uses her income to support the husband in the payment of utility bills.  Josephine will use the loan to purchase more local fabrics and clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine plans to save to invest into her childrens education.

loans.use: Josephine will use the loan to purchase more local fabrics and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A., married with five dependents, received education through senior high school.  Christiana has been selling baked bread and a locally-made cocoa drink near Nyankumasi since 2004. She uses her income to support her husband, who is a builder, in the payment of utility bills.  Christiana will use the loan to purchase maize and sugar and other baking ingredients. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to save to further expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase maize and sugar and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Janett Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Janett D. de 44 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y esforzada para lograr una estabilidad económica en su vida, desde horas temprana se levanta para ir a trabajar en un kiosco que tiene en un colegio en donde vende variados productos a los jóvenes como: frescos, helados, enchilada, golosinas, gaseosas y otros alimento que prepara para vender día a día. Lleva cuatro años administrando el kiosco y espera seguir ya que las venta son buenas es por eso con este financiamiento aumentara las compras para ofertar sus productos y elevar las ventas. Son ocho ciclos los que lleva en Afodenic ya que ha logrado superarse en su negocio solidó, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer unos remodelaciones a su casa, a si como ampliar el local de las ventas. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible su incremento en las ventas.
texts.en:
Janett D. is 44 years old. She is a determined woman and works hard to achieve economic stability in her life. She gets up early to work in a kiosk that she has at a highschool where she sells various products to the students, such as: fruit drinks, ice cream, enchiladas, sweets, soft drinks, and other foods that she makes to sell every day. She has been selling at the kiosk for four years and hopes to continue there because sales are good. With this loan she will increase her stock to offer more products and increase her sales. She has been with Afodenic for eight loan cycles and has been able to achieve having a solid business. Her plans are to finish making a few changes to her house and to expand her place of business. She gives thanks to the institution for making her increased sales possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, and sweets to increase her sales at her kiosk

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Chocolate proviene del centro de la ciudad Masaya, formado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y de origen muy humilde que trabajan a diario para la mejora de las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Cecilia del Carmen M. L. de 39 años de edad trabaja en la compra y venta de artesanías como lo son: Marimbas, Sombreros y juguetes hechos artesanalmente. 

Compra los juguetes en Monimbó (ciudad destacada por su cultura artesanal) y los vende según la temporada y la demanda de estos. Su metaes construir una bodega para tener donde guardar sus productos ya que tiene que alquilar un local.

Luz P. vende lencería en la zona franca, y en su casa vende confites y galletas a los niños; Ángela O. hace dulces típicos y boquita (Crispetas churritos, palomitas, platanitos) que vende al por mayor a vendedores ambulantes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Chocolate” comes from the central area of the city of Masaya. The group consists of three women entrepreneurs of humble origins who work every day to improve the lives of their families.

Cecilia del Carmen M. L. is 39 years old. She buys and sells crafts such as marimbas, hats, and handmade toys. She buys the toys in Monimbó (a city known for its artisan culture) and sells them according to the season and the level of demand. Her goal is to build a store where she can sell her products instead of having to rent a vending space.

Luz P. sells lingerie in “La Zona Franca” (a designated area where merchandise is sold free of import duties or taxes). She also makes candy and cookies at home and sells them to the neighborhood children. Ángela O. makes traditional candy and snacks (fried dough, popcorn, and plantain chips) that she sells wholesale to street vendors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es: La joven Rosa Patricia López de 29 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, cursan la primaria, su esposo trabaja de albañil en los diferentes barrio de la capital de Managua, reside en Laureles Sur. Ella trabaja en zona franca de inspectora un trabajo duro por que tienen un mal trato los chinos como un salario bajo, pero por la prosperacion y bienestar de sus hijos sigue trabajando y por el desempleo es cada día mas critico en Nicaragua. Con los préstamos que Afodenic ha otorgado ha podido hacer las mejoras a su vivienda ya que los materiales de construcción están caros y solo mediante el financiamiento los pobres podemos construir. Con este comprara materiales de construcción para terminar muro en la parte de adelante como a tras de la vivienda para asegurarse un poco de los delincuentes y para mayor seguridad de su familia. Espera poder tener su propio negocio y ver mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa Patricia López is 29 years old, is married, and has two children who are 8 and 10 years old and are in primary school. Her husband works as a mason in various neighborhoods in Managua. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She works as an inspector in a free trade zone, which is a difficult job because of poor treatment by the factory owners and low wages. However, for the prosperity and wellbeing of her family she continues working, and because of the unemployment that is more critical every day in Nicaragua. With the loans she has received from Afodenic she has been able make improvements to her house. Construction materials are expensive and it is only with financing that people with low incomes are able to build. With this loan she will buy construction materials to finish a wall in front of and behind her house, to safeguard against criminals and to improve the security of her family. She hopes to have her own business and earn a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, cement, and steel to build a wall in front of her house

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet H. sells and distributes assorted soft drinks on retail at castle near Nyankumasi.  Janet has received vocational training.  She is widow and has four children. Janet has been selling soft drinks since 2001. She is responsible for paying school fees, feeding and settlement of utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to take care of her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Hernarldo Jose

texts.es: Hernaldo José R. B. tiene 24 años, es un joven muy responsable y le gusta mucho su trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que sus inicios nacen por su familia su Papa era el responsable del negocio, por lo que desde muy joven a prendió este oficio, muy responsablemente se hizo cargo que su hijo aprendiera este oficio que sería beneficioso en futuro, Por lo que aprendió a manejarlo arduamente. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como fue la competencia con otros comerciantes. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de leche, que será utilizada para la elaboración queso, cuajada, crema y leche agria. Su deseo es poder exportar sus productos para el exterior.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: San Sebastián Group

texts.es:
Erika Concepción C. M. de 38 años de edad, de carácter  alegre, jovial y responsable, es la coordinadora del grupo San Sebastián, originario de la ciudad de Monimbo, de la zona que llaman Calles Reales (Por estar en el centro de la cuidad y ser principal vinculo con los pueblos blancos).ç

Su negocio es la elaboración de postres típicos como buñuelos, ojaldras, relámpagos, entre otros. Ella los vende tanto en su casa y en los distribuye en la zona franca de Tipitapa.

Erika tenía una panadería, que se vio truncada por el alza repentina en la materia prima. Su maquinaria quedo varada y sufrió muchas pérdidas debido a una crisis económica que pasaron. Actualmente desde más de 2 años, se dedico a la venta de postres, pero con este crédito quiere iniciar la venta de Donas y Churros de queso.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Onelia Guadalupe D. quien trabaja en la elaboración de bordados; Miguelina M. quien vende postres típicos y Ana Liseth F. quien trabaja los derivados del maíz como tortillas, revueltas, atoles de maíz, cereales entre otros.
texts.en:
Erika Concepción C. M. is a 38 years old. She is a responsible woman with a cheerful and jovial personality. Erika serves as the coordinator of the San Sebastián Group, whose members are originally from the city of Monimbo. They live in an area called Calles Reales, which is in the central part of the city and the main link to Los Pueblos Blancos (a picturesque village known for its white stucco buildings).

Erika prepares traditional desserts such as sweet fritters, fry bread, éclairs, and other types of pastries. She sells her products out of her home and also distributes them in the free trade zone of Tipitapa. Erika had a bakery, but she was forced to close because of the sudden rise in the price of ingredients. Her equipment was confiscated and she suffered tremendous losses because of the economic crisis that occurred. She has now been making desserts for 2 years, so she will use her loan to start selling donuts and fried cheese snacks.

The other members are: Onelia Guadalupe D. who makes embroideries; Miguelina M. who sells traditional desserts; and Ana Liseth F. who sells products made of corn such as tortillas, stuffed flatbread, porridge, cereal, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Lourdes Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Lourdes M. de 43 años de edad, trabaja junto con su esposo para salir adelante con la familia, tiene tres hijos dos trabaja y uno de 17 años esta estudiando, su negocio es una pulpería y su esposo vende carne el cual ambos tienen sus clientes. Reside en el barrio pantasma en la capital de Managua, su venta la inicio con ahorros y luego opto por financiamiento de crédito en Afodenic el cual ha logrado invertir mas en su inventario, con este crédito es su tercer ciclo y comprara granos básicos que es lo elemental para toda familia Nicaragüense. A futuro espera invertir más para obtener mejores resultado económico.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida de ocupación comerciante de frutas tiene su puesto de venta en su misma zona, su esposo trabaja en la Embajada de España como chofer, tiene 4 hijos, si bien viven en casa propia la misma es de adobe y ladrillo ubicada en la zona Tahuantinsuyo de la Ciudad de El Alto la cual está en proceso de refacción no la terminaron por falta de material.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción y así poder terminar la refacción de su hogar para una mejor comodidad familiar.
 
Es el tercer crédito, sus créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente,
La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Adelaida.

loans.use: Refaccion

loans.name: María Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo María Isabel está formado por tres mujeres de presencia muy humilde, pero emprendedoras, esforzadas y sobre todo excelentes negociantes, característica que destaca a la mujer Nicaragüense.

Irenia es la coordinadora, tiene 39, es la más joven del grupo pero es muy dinámica. Trabaja en la venta de verduras en el merado de Masaya. Negocio que ejerce desde hace 15 años cuando de su propia iniciativa y con capital propio  tomo la decisión de hacer esta actividad.

Le ha resultado un buen negocio y con la ayuda de los créditos en ADIM ha logrado acrecentar su negocio, siendo su respaldo sus hijas mayores quienes le ayudan a atender a sus clientes. Su meta es lograr ver un negocio más grande que sobresalga de los demás para que sus clientes se sientan atraídos.

Joanna P. y Elsa M. también trabajan en el mismo negocio, se conocieron en este ambiente y son muy buenas amigas. Se apoyan y respaldan mutuamente. 

Tiene un excelente record de crédito y esperan seguir creciendo con cada ciclo que tengan, este es el onceavo ciclo.
texts.en:
The María Isabel Group consist of three women with very humble demeanors. They are enterprising, hardworking, and most of all, excellent negotiators, qualities possessed by many Nicaraguan women.

Irenia is 39 years old and the group coordinator. She is the youngest and most dynamic member of the group. Irenia sells vegetables at the market in Masaya. With her own initiative and capital, she started her business 15 years ago. Her results have been good, and with the help of loans from ADIM, she has been able to grow her business. She now has the assistance of her older daughters who help attend to the customers. Her goal is to have a larger business that stands out from the others and attracts more customers.

Joanna P. and Elsa M. are also involved in the same line of business. They met through work and have become very good friends who support and encourage one another. The group has an excellent credit record and hope to continue growing with each loan cycle. This will be their eleventh loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. is a widow and has five dependants. She has received senior high education.  Elizabeth sells palm oil, coconut oil and palm kernel oil at Elmina, which she has been doing since the year 2000. Elizabeth uses her income in payment of school fees and settlement of utility bills.  Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more of her oils for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more of her oils for sale.

loans.name: Jacinta Del Socorro

texts.es: Jacinta del Socorro T. es cliente de Fundación León 2000, ella es una buena cliente, además le gusta el servicio que se le ofrece.  La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, es una mujer que ha aprendido muchas lecciones difíciles en la vida, pero siempre ha salido adelante, por lo que como todo comienzo fue difícil porque no tenía el capital de trabajo suficiente, pero con la ayuda de una amiga que le brindo el apoyo necesario logro comprar lo suficiente. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para damas, ropa para caballero, ropa para niños, calzado, cosméticos y perfumes. El mayor deseo que tiene es seguir adelante con sus metas propuestas.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: El Progreso Del Manguito 4 Group

texts.en:
Chisell is the group coordinator of her Bank of Hope and an associate of Esperanza International, is currently looking to begin her third loan cycle. She is from a barrio called Manguito which is in Santo Domingo, the large, hot capital of the Dominican Republic. She lives  with her husband and their two children, ages one and two, in a cement house in an area where running water and electricity are unreliable.

Chisell is planning on using this loan to continue the business that she began with her first two loans. She sells sheets and bed spreads to her clients who come from the nearby area. With her last loan she was able to buy a washing machine, and with this loan she hopes to be able to sell enough of her products to buy a kitchen table for her family. She has enjoyed working with Esperanza so far and hopes that this prosperous partnership will continue!

loans.use: To purchase sheets and bed spreads to sell

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es: Baltazar V. Canton Urbina de 34 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico en el departamento de La Libertad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Yanira de 6 años de edad y Jefferson de 10 meses. Baltazar posee una tienda, instalada en su casa, que se ubica en un pequeño cantón  donde no hay competencia de sus productos, el crédito que solicita Baltazar es para surtir su negocio, de esa manera aprovechara la demanda de su tienda y aumentaran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Baltazar V. Urbina Canton is 34 years old and lives in San Juan Opico, which is in the department of La Libertad. He has a wife and two children, Yanira (age 6) and Jefferson (age 10 months). Baltazar operates a grocery store out of his home. Since he lives in a small community, there are no other competitors for the products he sells.

The loan he is requesting will be used to restock his store. The additional capital will enable him to meet customer demand and increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his business

loans.name: Maite Guadalupe

texts.es: Maite Guadalupe R. de 22 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Chalatenango, Maite vive con su madre, juntas administran y atienden el negocio familiar; una tienda de productos de consumo básico y otros como ropa y papelería. Maite y su madre son muy conocidas en su colonia como personas trabajadoras y honestas. El crédito que solicita Maite es para surtir su negocio y convertirlo en una tienda de variedades, donde sus clientes puedan encontrar de todo, sin necesidad de buscar en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Maite Guadalupe R. is 22 years old and resides in the Chalatenango region. Maite lives with her mother, and together they administer and attend to the family business, a store that sells basic consumer products and other products such as clothes and stationery. Maite and her mother are well known in their neighborhood as hardworking and honest people. The loan that Maite is requesting will be used to supply her store and convert it into a variety store, where her customers can find everything without having to look anyplace else.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supply her store

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth S. Ramírez tiene la edad de 74 años, su estado civil es soltera, ella es una mujer muy trabajador y luchadora además disfruta mucho su trabajo pues la mayoría del tiempo recibe halagos de parte de sus clientes por su deliciosa comida. La actividad económica es la  elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de  28 años que se dedica a este negocio humilde pero beneficioso, por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia y se da por los estudiantes que fueron los que propusieron la idea para encargar la elaboración de la comida y es así como se hace cargo de este negocio es una de las experiencias que más le ha gustado. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ingredientes, verduras, frutas y lo más importante granos básicos. Su deseo es mantener este negocio que es su medio de vida.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Brigida Leticia

texts.es: La sra. Brigida tiene su movilidad de la cual percibe una renta diaria, además también se dedica a la serigrafía con su esposo, realizan trabajos en llaveros, boligrafos y otros para diferentes instituciones, vive en la casa de sus suegros y tiene dos niños en edad escolar,su esposo trabaja en una empresa de serigrafia y diseño gráfico, por las noches elaboran los trabajos en serigrafia. Es una cliente antigua de la institución, trabaja con nosotros desde el año 2005, es muy responsable, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de material para elaborar los trabajos en serigrafía.
texts.en:
Brigida has a taxi, from which she receives rent each day. She also works in screen printing with her husband. They print on key rings, pens, and other items for various institutions. She lives in her in-law’s house and has two children of school age. Her husband works for a screen printing and graphic design company, and at night they make the screen printed items. She is a long-time client of the institution and has been working with us since 2005. She is very responsible. She will invest the loan in buying materials for screen printing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest the loan in buying materials for screen printing

loans.name: Angela Veronica

texts.es:
Ángela Verónica Z. López  es socia del  Banco Comunal Dinámicas ubicado en el cantón  Tosagua a una hora de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí. Ella está casada desde hace 24 años fruto de su matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 22 y 21 años, el mayor de ellos está casado, el esposo  de Angela tiene un transporte público de pasajeros en la localidad. Actualmente ella junto a su familia viven en la casa de su suegra en un departamento independiente.

Ángela se dedica al comercio  informal desde hace veinte años,  se inició vendiendo  ropa puerta a puerta,  con el pasar del tiempo fue incrementando  otra mercaderia   logrando  que su negocio crezca.  Ella ha improvisado un pequeño bazar en su casa con unas vitrinas para exhibir su mercadería, tiene a la venta carteras, ropa para damas caballeros y niños, productos de belleza, zapatos y mas, en la mañana  atiende en el  local  y por la tarde  visita a sus clientes en sus domicilios dejándoles mercadería a crédito, de esa manera se gana la vida, recorre a pie la ciudad y esta contenta con su trabajo y no piensa  cambiarlo.

En  esta época del año  Ángela invierte mas capital ya que considera una buena época para las ventas por eso esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir  en la compra de  mas mercadería pues tiene ya varios pedidos de pantalones, blusas, zapatos, bisutería y más.

Para  Ángela al igual que muchas otras socias del banco comunal  estan seguras que realizar sus sueños no es imposible y con la ayuda de la Fundación  ella espera poder construir su propia casa y esta segura poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ángela Verónica Z. López is member of the community bank Dinámicas, located in the Tosagua County, one hour from Portoviejo, in the Manabí province. She has been married for 24 years. The offspring of this marriage are her two sons, 22 and 21 years old. Her older son is married. Ángela’s husband has a public transportation service business in the city. Currently, she and her family live in her mother-in-law’s house, in an independent apartment.

Ángela has been dedicated to the informal market for 20 years. She started selling clothes door-to-door. With time, she incremented her merchandise, which helped her business grow. She has improvised a small bazaar at her house, with some showcases to exhibit her merchandise. She sells wallets, women, men and children clothes, beauty products, shoes and other products. In the morning she receives her customers at the house bazaar and in the afternoon she visits her customers at their homes, offering them on credit merchandise. She makes a living this way. She goes around the city on foot but she is happy with her work and does not think of switching it.

This time of the year, Ángela invests more capital, since she considers this period a good selling season. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan to invest in buying more merchandise. She has many pre-orders for pants, blouses, shoes, costume jewelry and others.

Ángela, as many other members of the community bank, is certain that it is not impossible to realize her dreams. With the help of the Fundación she hopes to build her own house and she is confident that she will able to do it.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the buying of merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shoes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Carlos David

texts.es: Carlos David G. P. reside en Quezaltepeque en el departamento de La Libertad. Carlos vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años llamado igual que su padre Carlos David. Carlos posee un negocio donde ofrece servicios de reparación para moto taxis, polarizados en vehículos, diseños de calcomanías para vehículos. Carlos busca muchas posibilidades para generar ingresos para su familia, ahora el solicita este crédito por que le ha llegado mucho trabajo de reparación de moto taxis a su negocio y no quiere dejar ir la oportunidad de hacer estos trabajos  por no contar con los repuestos necesarios, es por ello que solicita este crédito para compra repuestos.

loans.use: Comprar repuestos para moto taxis

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: Juana Mercedes M. tiene 60 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por lo que su record crediticio es muy bueno.  Es una mujer casada y con su esposo tiene 2 niños que están a su cargo. La actividad económica de Doña Juana es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Los problemas que ha enfrentado Juana son de salud ya que debido a su edad es muy difícil tener la agilidad para servir a sus clientes, pero esto no le impide el seguir adelante. Pero por siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un gran carisma con sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pan, verduras entre otras cosas útiles para el hogar. Su deseo es mejorar su salud para continuar con el negocio.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ramona Antonia

texts.es: Ramona Antonio Benítez Castellón tiene 39 años, es una madre soltera y responsable con 2 hijos, actualmente solo 1 de sus hijos esta a su cargo. Ella tiene la actividad económica como es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que ella tiene este negocio, por lo que no fue fácil pasar todas las pruebas que cruzo para obtener este trabajo digno que le proporcionaría el pan de cada día a ella y a su familia. Ramona tiene toda la energía para visitar a sus clientes y promocionar sus productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar calzado, ropa para damas, ropa para caballeros, cosméticos y colonias. En un futuro le gustaría establecer su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Ramona Antonio Benítez Castellón, 29 years old, is a responsible single mother with two children. One of her children is now in her care. She works selling general merchandise and has had this business for more than five years. It was not easy for her to pass all the tests she encountered to obtain this dignified work that provides bread each day for her and her family. Ramona has the energy to visit her clients and promote her products. She seeks this financing for working capital to be able to buy footwear, clothing for women, clothing for men, cosmetics, and colognes. In the future she would like to establish her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the We are Leaders village bank. She is married, 46 years-old and has three children who are 27, 20, and 18. They work and study at an institute. Carmen is a geriatric nurse who worked at a hospital from 7 p.m. to 7a.m. for many years. She raised her children by herself when her husband stopped working and neglected his family. Twelve years ago, with the help of a friend, she started to sell clothes and shoes and her clients have increased. She has obtained new places to sell clothes and she travels all the way to Trujillo, Northern Peru, to bring back shoes and clothes to sell.

Carmen has received a lot of support and training for her business and how to obtain more clients from Kiva partner FINCA Peru. Carmen is asking for a loan of 800 soles to buy more shoes from Trujillo. Her dream is to have her own store to sell clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
Emperatriz is a member of the “We are Leaders” village bank. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 5. They both study at public school.

Emperatriz began to work in the afternoons as a cleaning lady for many years until she broke her arm and had to stop cleaning. Since nine years ago she has made her living selling sweets (candies) and sodas from her house. She began with a small table because she was not able to afford a showcase as they were very expensive. Also she began with all her goods in plastic so the sun wouldn’t affect them. She enjoyed her work because she was able to be close to her family.

With FINCA Peru, her economic situation and morale have changed for the better, thanks to the loans and the training which have helped her grow little by little. Emperatriz is happy for the successes in her life.

Emperatriz needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy an exhibition showcase, and more sweets and sodas. Her dream is to have a soda fountain and with hard work she will obtain it.

loans.use: To buy an exhibition showcase, sweets, and sodas

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the We are Leaders village bank. 
She is 39 years-old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 6. They study at public school. 
Guadalupe is from La Libertad, northern Peru. She arrived in Lima and started to study sewing but she did not like it so she stopped. Her mother-in-law has a stand that sells groceries typical of the jungle and Guadalupe wanted to work with her. Some months passed and her mother-in-law gave her the stand. 12 years have passed since she works there. She is very grateful to her mother-in-law. 
She is grateful to FINCA for the loans because she is able to invest them, her sales have been better and her economic situation has improved a little.  
She needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy dried fish called Paiche, flour from bananas, yucca. Everything is brought from the jungle. 
Her dream is that she wants to sell hot-dogs in the evenings from her house.

loans.use: buy dried fish called Paiche, flour from bananas, yucca

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a member of the We are Leaders village bank. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children aged 13 and 19. Her eldest child is studying to be a physical therapist and her youngest is in public school.

Filomena is from Puno. She studied sewing briefly in Lima, but was unable to finish her studies as she cannot speak Spanish very well. Filomena speaks Aymara, but no one in Lima speaks this dialect. In addition, she has trouble speaking and her friends criticize the way she speaks. Filomena worked in various areas until her aunt advised her to start raising pigs. Raising pigs is profitable, does not take all day, and buyers are always available.

Filomena is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN to buy feed for the pigs and sacks of sweet potatoes. Her dream is to buy a car and rent it out to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and sacks of sweet potatoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the We are Leaders village bank. She is 26 years old, lives with her partner, and has a son who is 12 years old and attends public school.

Margarita was making a living selling breakfast in the mornings from the house in which she used to live, but she stopped when she moved to the Pamplona district. There she realized that business was done differently. She took a knitting course where she learned to make purses. With the advice of her mother, who also knits, she started make purses and selling them to her neighbors. Now that she’s in the communal bank she knits five purses per week. At FINCA Peru, she has learned to manage and invest the loan she receives. Margarita is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN to buy materials for knitting purses and colored thread to decorate the purses. Her dream is to have a stand in the market to sell her purses and other goods.

loans.use: To buy materials for knitting and decorating purses

loans.name: Grupo Chi "perez " Group

texts.es:
Hace aproximadamente,  4 años se formaron grupos en chivarreto, con el fin de ampliar sus 						
producción de agropecuario, y  comercio, venta de pañuelos,  o tapetes, todas las personas 						
se conocen perfectamente,  tienen como visión, ampliar sus producciónes y como también ampliar						
sus capital de negocio, las personas,   lo hacen con el fin de poder ayudar a sus esposos, de esa

podrán ayudar a sus espoosos a mejorar los ingresos economicos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida 

y de la misma manera podrán ayudar al desarrollo de sus comunidades y de sus propias de familias.

loans.use: capital de comercio

loans.name: Positivas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Maria Nilda P. con 40 años de edad  tiene 1 hijo ella es peluquera trabaja en la peluquería de una prima, pero ahora esta por montar su propia peluquería en su casa para estar mas cerca de su hijo, ya que el niño queda bajo el cuidado de su abuela.
Tiene casa propia pero es madre soltera, de esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias para la venta.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Elsa Cedeño Z. es  socia del Banco Comunal Dinámicas  ubicado en el cantón  Tosagua a una hora de Portoviejo  en la Provincia de Manabí. 

La señora Elsa se dedica  al comercio informal, vende adornos de casa, ropa, bisutería y más artículos para el hogar, esta casada tiene dos hijos de 8 y 9 años, el esposo trabaja en un bus de cooperativa de transporte.

Elsa realiza sus ventas recorriendo las calles de la ciudad desde hace 5 años, visita a sus clientes en sus domicilios todos los días, sale a trabajar muy temprano y regresa en la noche, no desmaya en su labor.
 
El sueño de Elsa es tener su casita propia  para comodidad de sus hijos y para ampliar su negocio, además ha pensado  poner un negocio  de comida rápida en el centro de la ciudad donde ella vive,  aun no puede ver cristalizado sus sueños pero está segura de  poder lograrlo.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación lo  invertirá en la compra de   mercadería surtida como ropa, zapatos, bisuteria, articulos de bazar, etc,  para incrementar su negocio y  ver la  posibilidad de ahorrar para sus futuros planes
texts.en:
Elsa Cedeño Z. is a member of the “Dinámicas” Community Bank which is located in the territorial district of Tosagua, an hour from Portoviejo in the province of Manabí.

Ms. Elsa works in informal trade: she sells house decorations, clothing, costume jewelry, and other items for the home. She is married and has two children: one is 8 and the other is 9. Her husband works at a bus transportation cooperative.

Elsa has conducted her sales in the city streets for the past 5 years. Everyday she visits her customers in their homes. She goes to work very early and returns in the evening, but she does not get discouraged by this work.

Elsa dreams of having her own home for the comfort of her children and so she can expand her business. Even though she has thought of starting a fast food business in the center of the city where she lives, she still hasn’t been able to see her dreams realized. However, she is sure she will be able to achieve them.

She will use the loan requested from "Fundación ESPOIR" (a Kiva field partner) to buy assorted merchandise such as clothing, shoes, jewelry, bazaar items, etc. The loan will allow her to expand her business and possibly save up for her future plans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy assorted merchandise such as clothing, shoes, bazaar items, jewelry, etc., and to expand her business

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es: Lesbia del Socorro Hernández Manzanares tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Lesbia tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan. Doña Lesbia se dedica a la actividad económica como es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda por lo que inicio por cuenta propia ya que anteriormente no trabajaba y necesitaba cubrir los gastos de su casa y así decide dedicarse a este negocio. Es por eso que el propósito de Lesbia es comprar lo suficiente para abastecer la demanda. Y es así como solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así movilizarse hasta las diferentes comarcas ya que es aquí donde es favorable la compra de los cerdos. Los sueños de Lesbia son de establecer un restaurante.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Positivas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo. El mismo consta de 15 integrantes que realizan distintos tipos de actividades comerciales para poder obtener ingresos extras para sus familias.

Las actividades que realizan son:

Elizabeth C.	Venta de hamburguesa
Graciela L.	
Ada O.	Venta de Avon
Juana C.	Vta  de Quiniela
Irma G.	Venta de Ropas

Beatriz B.	Venta de frutas 
Irma B.	Venta de comestible
Dionicia F.	Venta de empanadas
Silvina C.	Venta de ropas
Maria F.	Modista
Carmen A.	Vta de ropas
Canuta L.	Venta de Quiniela
Maria M.	Venta de Quiniela
Leopoldina Y.	Venta deAvon
Cinthia O.	Fotocopiadoras 


 Todas estas mujeres son un ejemplo de sacrificio. Podemos  citar como ejemplo a doña Juana C. de 65 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a hacer su Quiniela (venta de loterías) por la mañana luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su quiniela.

Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precarios. De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela.
texts.en:
The committee is currently in its third cycle. It consits of the same 15 members who are in different commercial activities to earn extra income for their families. The activities they do are: Elizabeth C. – Hamburger sales Graciela L. Ada O. –Avon sales Juana C. - Lottery sales Irma G. –Clothing sales Beatriz B. – Fruit sales Irma B. – Grocery sales Dionicia F. –Empanada sales Silvina C. – Clothing sales Maria F. – Fashion designer Carmen A. – Clothing sales Canuta L. –Lottery sales Maria M. – Lottery sales Leopoldina Y. – Avon sales Cinthia O. – Photocopiers

All of these women provide an example of sacrifice. We can site, as an example, Juana C., 65 years old. She has two children that stay at home while she does her lottery sales in the morning. Later, she returns home to prepare lunch and then goes out again in the afternoon to do more lottery sales.

This is a hard-working woman who has a burdensome day to day life, because upon returning from work she has to do the housework, and everything she does is for the future well-being of her children as a single mother. She has a small home made of unstable materials. In this way, she can keep up with the costs of her house and her children who go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as groceries, lottery, make-up, lotions, clothing, etc...

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO II; están situados en la ciudad del Cusco, teniendo su cede de reunión en el distrito de huanchac.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio y servicios diversos, entre los socios hay taxistas, mecánicos, socias que tienen tiendas de abarrotes, librería, docente, venta de productos de belleza, venta de leña, venta de anticuchos (carnes a la parrilla); y otra socia que vende golosinas. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios y así ver mayor ganancia en menor tiempo.


Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Patron de San Jeronimo II" are located in the city of Cusco, having their meeting headquarters in the Huanchac district. Our members alternate their various activities between different business and services. Among the members there are taxi drivers, mechanics, members that have grocery stores, a bookstore, a teacher, and members who sell beauty products, wood, anticuchos (grilled meats) and another member who sells candy. Our members are requesting the loan to reinvest in their different businesses and in this way see greater earnings in a smaller amount of time. Our members are thankful and value the loan granted in this manner and at the same time promise to make their repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Soledad es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Soledad se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, bocaditos, decoraciones de locales para diferentes eventos, tiene una tienda de exhibiciones.
Soledad necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas para decoración.
Los sueños de Soledad son ampliar su negocio y tener una empresa, tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de telas para decoración.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Claudia es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Claudia se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas son por las tardes en el mercado Santa Clara, además Claudia vende ropa en la feria de las Américas.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Claudia son tener una panadería y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de harina.

loans.name: Ruth Nohemi

texts.es: Ruth Nohemí C. Dávila tiene 27 años, a esta edad tan joven es una persona responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo. Ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa, hace más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que dio inicio por qué no tenía trabajo en lo que ella estudio, además tiene 1 hijo  del cual se hace cargo, y con mucha más razón tenía que luchar en la vida por lo que tiene que proporcionarle el pan de cada día. Poco apoco ha mejorado ciertos aspectos en su negocio que son los necesarios para seguir adelante. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de faldas, pantalones, camisas, shorts, camisolas y ropa interior. Su deseo es proporcionarle a su hija una educación digna y que algún día pueda tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ruth Nohemí C. Dávila is 27 years old. She is a responsible young woman who enjoys her work. She has been selling clothes for more than 11 years. Ruth started this business because she did not have a job in her field of study. In addition, she has a child to support, which is more reason why she has to struggle in life to meet her daily needs. Over time, she has improved certain aspects of her business that are necessary for her to succeed. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy skirts, pants, shirts, shorts, undershirts, and lingerie. She hopes to provide her daughter with a decent education and eventually have greater financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Lourdes es casada, tiene 62 años y 8 hijos, Lourdes tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Lourdes necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Lourdes piensa trabajar para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the "Llamkasun" (which means "We Work") Community Bank. Lourdes is married, is 62 years old and has eight children. Lourdes has a shop in her home where she sells general groceries, work that she performs every day. Lourdes needs a loan of 1050 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Lourdes plans to work to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Alejandrina es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hija, Alejandrina tiene un salón de Belleza llamado Mayumi, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza sola todos los días.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tintes y líquidos.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son tener un salón en el centro de la ciudad y una tienda de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a partner in the Llamkasun Communal Bank. Llamkasun means "We work". Alejandrina is a single 27 year old mother with 1 daughter. She has a beauty salon named Mayumi in a rented space, where she works every day. Alejandrina requests a 1050 sol loan, which she will invest in the purchase of hair color and liquid beauty supplies. Alejandrina dreams of one day having a beauty salon in the downtown area of the city, along with a cosmetics store. os.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair color and liquid beauty supplies

loans.name: Crecelia

texts.es:
Crecelia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Crecelia es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 4 hijos, Creselia vende carne al por mayor, los animales los adquiere en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Crecelia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de animales.
Los sueños de Crecelia son tener un puesto estable y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Crecelia is a partner in the Llamkasun Communal Bank. Llamkasun means "we work". Crecelia is a 29 year old woman. She lives with her 4 children and their father. Creselia sells wholesale meat, acquiring livestock from different markets around the area. Crecelia is requesting a 1500 sol loan which she will invest in the purchase of livestock. Crecelia dreams of one day having a permanent stand and of offering her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Josefa Betty

texts.es:
Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Josefa es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Josefa vende frutas variadas en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria, ademas Josefa trabaja en una panaderia. Josefa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en su casa.
Josefa necesita un prestamo de 1200 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de pollos y cuy.
Los sueños de Josefa son tener una negocio estable y una pasteleria.

loans.use: Para la compra de pollos y cuy.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Catalina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Catalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además Catalina brinda el servicio de bordado y tejido de carteras, correas, también teje chompas a pedido.
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Catalina son mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
Nolberto es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Nolberto es casado, tiene 63 años y 4 hijos, Nolberto junto a su esposa tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, además vende ollas renaware por catalogo. Nolberto también brinda servicios de instalaciones eléctricas, pisos, etc.
Nolberto necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una compresora y cortadora.
Los sueños de Nolberto son construir el tercer piso de su casa y viajar al extranjero.
texts.en:
Nolberto is a partner in the Ccori Ayllu Communal Bank. Ccori Ayllu means "The Golden Family". Nolberto is is 63 year old married man with 4 children. Together with his wife he runs a convenience store from his home. The store also sells Renaware pots through catalog order. Nolberto offers construction services, doing electrical work and flooring installation, etc. Nolberto is requesting a 1000 sol loan which he will invest in the purchase of an air compressor and a saw. He dreams of adding a 3rd floor to his house, and of someday traveling to other countries.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an air compressor and saw

loans.name: Cledy Pilar

texts.es:
Cledy es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Cledy es casada, tiene 19 años y 1 hijo, Cledy se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos en el horno de sus padres, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en los diferentes pueblos de la región.
Cledy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Cledy son tener una pastelería en el centro de la ciudad y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
